chunks.original_text: 尔时玉皇即以所分之身徧於是处，白玉京中、黄金阙内七宝玄苑大光明殿光明座上，普为十方演说清净解脱之道。 右《分演妙道章》，并已详校，略无舛误。 臣谨言曰：浊世众生，不悟真道，是以七情六欲纵而不收，万过千愆，积而不解，地狱之报，目暝不逃。 岂意上帝之慈，敷恩赦度，俾之径陟净境，快乐无涯。 然岂知积福生天，福尽犹不免於复坠，况承恩而生，则生天之缘，直以恩之所及也。 苟昧进修，曷为解脱？ 玉帝圣恩优渥，犹欲终俾解脱，故为宣说清净之道，俾诸天人获究竟之果。 吁，慈泽混浩，慈意深远，天人其可不勉自进趣，以副玉帝接度之意乎？ 人世众生，宜思玉帝赦度拯接苦趣之迹，勉勉为善，勿自暴弃，则帝恩之降，殆不止若是也。 虽然，是章载玉帝为天人说清净解脱之道，而以下诸章并不见玉帝所说清净解脱之语，何也？ 盖玉帝以一切玉女侍卫，而玉女真身流香，默寓清净解脱之旨，以至於诸趣承光觉悟，及妙音宣演等事，莫非清净解脱之意。 是乃玉帝不言之言也。 结经诸真，默识是义，直纪普为十方演说清净解脱之道。 吁，识洞帝心，见彻事外，结经之真，其造妙通玄，有如此者，诚不可思议也。 夫诵经之士，其因兹而求之。 臣良谨言。 时化玉帝各以无量天真大圣、妙行真人、灵妃玉女侍列左右，是诸玉女，颜容殊妙，端严奇特，天珍异宝。 谓天上之珍，奇异之宝也。 旧本以天珍为天真，今更正之。 庄严身相，言音清彻，众所乐闻。 如是诸女，其身复出微妙解脱自然之香。 是香芬馥，周徧诸天。 旧本云能徧诸天。 夫玉女身香之出自然，充满法界，若以能字加於徧字之上，则能乃强然也。 今正其误为周字。 极妙乐土及余大地一切福处。 六道一切众生， 一本云能令六道一切众生。 夫六道苦趣自然闻香，初非强使闻之也。 今正其误，削此能令二字。 闻是香者，普蒙开度。 所谓天道、人道、魔道、地狱道、饿鬼道、畜生道。 旧本畜生道下有当此已后四字。 夫玉女出香，六道於当时得闻，初非在此以后也。 神仙口传，纪录有误。 今削当此已后四字。 若诸天道，一切天人或有能闻是此香者，五衰之相，永得灭除，转增天福。 若诸人道，王臣兆庶或有能闻是此香者，即得人天长寿之乐，身或灭度，及得脱壳尸解之道。 若诸魔道，一切诸魔或有能闻是此香者，安处天宫，斗战之苦，各得休息。 若诸地狱道，一切众生或有能闻是此香者，离地狱苦，得净土乐。 若诸饿鬼道，一切饿鬼等。 旧本云一切饿鬼神等。 臣窃谓神趣虽有亦堕饿鬼道者，然既堕鬼趣，即是鬼矣。 今着神字，似碍神只之神。 谨削此一字。 或有能闻是此香者，即得饱满，无饥渴恼。 若诸畜生道，一切畜生， 旧本云一切众生。 前地狱言众生，今此畜生道之下当作畜生。 今有间别，故易众字为畜字。 或有能闻是此香者，脱畜生苦，得智慧乐。 右《闻香解脱章》，并已详校，更正讫。 臣谨言曰：理之常者，众人之所共知； 理之异者，虽贤哲亦或未悟也。 臣於《闻香解脱章》敢悉鄙见，以告人世云：臣窃见玉帝於七宝玄苑放光之初，下方人民，地狱苦趣，并承光照，已皆生天矣。 今经於玉帝分身普现之后，复载玉帝分现之时，以诸大圣、玉女侍卫，又载玉女身香徧於是处，而六道众生闻香者莫不解脱。
chunks.translated_text:
At that time, the Jade Emperor, with his divided form, pervaded this realm, ascending to the White Jade Capital, within the Golden Gate’s Seven-Treasured Mystic Gardens, upon the Great Radiant Hall’s Radiant Seat, and universally expounded the Dao of pure liberation to all directions.

The *Chapter on the Division and Propagation of the Marvelous Dao* has been meticulously collated, with no errors remaining. The subject humbly speaks:

In this turbid age, sentient beings fail to awaken to the True Dao. Thus, the seven emotions and six desires run wild, unchecked, and myriad offenses accumulate without resolution—geohellish retribution cannot be evaded. Who would have thought the Celestial Sovereign’s mercy, spreading forgiveness and deliverance, grants them direct ascent to pure realms of boundless joy?

Yet how could they know that even those born from accumulated merit, once their merit is exhausted, still cannot escape rebirth? How much more so those who, by grace alone, attain heavenly birth—such birth is merely the extent of the grace received. If they remain ignorant of cultivation, how can they attain liberation?

The Jade Emperor’s saintly grace is boundless, yet He still desires their ultimate liberation. Thus, He proclaims the Dao of pure liberation, so that all celestial and human beings may attain the supreme fruit.

Ah! His benevolent radiance is vast and profound, His compassionate intent far-reaching. How can the celestial and human beings fail to strive and advance, to fulfill the Jade Emperor’s intent of guiding and delivering them?

Mortal beings should reflect on the Jade Emperor’s act of pardoning, rescuing, and delivering them from suffering, and diligently do good, lest they abandon themselves. Then, the descent of imperial grace shall not be as limited as this.

Although this chapter records the Jade Emperor teaching celestial and human beings the Dao of pure liberation, the subsequent chapters do not explicitly mention His teaching of pure liberation. Why is this?

It is because the Jade Emperor, surrounded by all the Jade Maidens as attendants, has their true forms naturally emit fragrant essence, subtly containing the meaning of pure liberation. Thus, all beings in the six paths, illuminated by this light, awaken and comprehend, and through wondrous sounds and proclamations, all are expressions of pure liberation.

This is the Jade Emperor’s unsaid speech.

The sages who compiled the scripture, silently recognizing this truth, merely recorded: *"The Jade Emperor universally expounds the Dao of pure liberation to all directions."*

Ah! Those who perceive the Emperor’s heart and see through the outer events—these sages who compiled the scripture, their profound and mysterious composition is beyond measure, truly inconceivable.

Let those who recite the scripture seek this meaning.

The subject humbly speaks:

At that time, the Jade Emperor was attended by countless celestial maidens—Great Saints of the Boundless Heavens, Marvelous Conduct Immortals, and Sacred Consorts—arrayed on either side. These maidens possessed extraordinary and solemn beauty, adorned with celestial treasures and rare jewels. *"Celestial treasures"* refers to celestial maidens; *"rare jewels"* refers to extraordinary treasures. The old text mistakenly rendered *"celestial treasures"* as *"celestial maidens."* Now corrected.

Their forms were resplendent, their voices clear and piercing, delightful to all who heard. Moreover, their bodies naturally emitted a subtle, marvelous fragrance of spontaneous liberation. This fragrance, pervading all heavens—*the old text read "able to pervade all heavens."* If the character *"able"* is added before *"pervade,"* it implies forced action. Now corrected to *"surrounding."*

It filled the most wondrous lands of bliss and all other fortunate places on earth. All beings in the six paths—*the old text read "able to make all beings in the six paths."* The six paths suffer naturally from the fragrance; it was not forced upon them. Now corrected by removing *"able to."*

Those who heard this fragrance were universally enlightened. These six paths include the paths of celestial beings, humans, asuras, hells, hungry ghosts, and animals. *The old text appended "from this point onward"* beneath *"animal path."* The maidens’ fragrance was heard by all six paths at that time; it was not limited to afterward. This was a mistake in oral transmission. Now removed.

If celestial beings in the celestial path heard this fragrance, the signs of decline would be permanently eradicated, and their heavenly merit would increase.

If humans in the human path—kings, ministers, and commoners—heard this fragrance, they would attain the joy of longevity in human and celestial realms, or their bodies would be liberated through *shell-discardance* or *corpse-resolution.*

If asuras in the asura path heard this fragrance, they would dwell peacefully in heavenly palaces, free from the suffering of battle.

If beings in the hellish path heard this fragrance, they would escape hellish torment and attain the bliss of pure lands.

If hungry ghosts in the hungry ghost path—*the old text read "all hungry ghost spirits."* The subject humbly suggests that while spirits may occasionally fall into the hungry ghost path, once fallen, they are ghosts. The addition of *"spirit"* seems to confuse with *"only spirit."* Now removed—heard this fragrance, they would be sated, free from hunger and thirst.

If animals in the animal path—*the old text read "all beings."* Earlier, the hellish path mentioned *"all beings,"* but here, the animal path requires distinction, so *"beings"* is changed to *"animals"*—heard this fragrance, they would escape animal suffering and attain the joy of wisdom.

The *Chapter on Liberation Through Fragrance* has been meticulously collated and corrected.

The subject humbly speaks:

There are truths that are common knowledge, known even to ordinary people, and truths that are unusual—even the wise may not comprehend them. The subject dares to present his humble views on the *Chapter on Liberation Through Fragrance* to the world:

The subject observes that when the Jade Emperor first emitted light from the Seven-Treasured Mystic Gardens, all beings in the lower realms, including those in hellish suffering, were already born into heaven by that light. Now, the scripture records that after the Jade Emperor’s divided form manifested, He was attended by great saints and maidens, and it further states that the maidens’ fragrance pervaded this realm, yet all beings in the six paths who heard it attained liberation.

chunks.original_text: 世人之疑，谓人民苦趣，既以帝光生天，用生天之事是帝光之效也，奚与於玉女之身香乎？ 吁，此疑议非人世之罪也。 盖事出於常理之外，有不容不疑，奚足怪哉？ 臣谨明之，以释世人之惑。 恭惟天尊，今兹说经，正为欲发明清净之法门也。 夫女人之身，纯阴之质也。 惟其纯阴，故常与不净为邻。 惟其邻於不净，故其身鲜有芬馥之致。 乃今一切玉女能与玉帝行解见识等并同清净，故其身虽纯阴、邻於不净，而微妙解脱自然之香，乃出於其身。 譬之世人处於浊恶，苟能俾心见识行等悉处净乡，则异香之微妙解亦当生於其身也。 此经专以清净真一解脱为主，故结经众真专纪玉女身香一事，发明妙旨。 虽然，香虽名香，要当以理论，不可着物而言也。 凡人之身苟无过无咎，知道悟真，凡出一言、行一行，为众人之所欣羡赞叹，则亦犹玉女之身，不浊不秽，有微妙解脱之香，为诸天福处之所闻。 玉女譬之则浊身也，香譬之则我之言行也，香徧於诸天福处譬之则言行发见於千里之外也，六道闻香而解脱譬之善言善行见用於世而利益於人物也。 此乃修行之径，含生其味而行之。 妄揣若兹，言略意窒。 仰惟上圣鉴之，人世信之。 臣良谨言。
chunks.translated_text:
The doubts of the worldly folk arise: *"If ordinary beings in suffering were already born into heaven by the Emperor’s light, why then does the scripture speak of the maidens’ fragrance?"*

Ah! Such questions are not the fault of the world.

For matters beyond the scope of common reason, there are doubts that cannot be avoided—what is strange in this?

The subject humbly elucidates this, to dispel the world’s confusion.

With reverence, he addresses the Heavenly Venerable:

Now, in this teaching of the scripture, the true intention is to reveal the gate of pure and unadulterated liberation.

The female form is of essence purely yin. Because it is purely yin, it is ever close to impurity. Because it is close to impurity, the female body rarely possesses the disposition of sweet fragrance.

Yet now, all the maidens are able to align with the Jade Emperor in wisdom, insight, and purity—equal in their pristine nature. Thus, though their bodies are purely yin and near impurity, a subtle and wondrous fragrance of natural liberation arises from them.

Compare it to worldly people dwelling in filth and corruption: if they could make their hearts, insights, and actions all abide in a land of purity, then the exquisite fragrance of liberation would likewise emanate from their persons.

This scripture is devoted entirely to the pure and singular liberation of truth, hence its conclusion focuses solely on the maidens’ fragrance to reveal its profound meaning.

Though it is called fragrance, its essence must be understood through theory—not by clinging to material form.

For ordinary people, if they have no transgressions or faults, if they know the Dao and awaken to truth, and if every word they speak and every deed they perform is praised and admired by all, then their bodies are like those of the maidens—neither foul nor unclean, bearing a subtle and wondrous fragrance of liberation, heard by the blessed abodes of the heavens.

The maidens are like the impure body, while the fragrance is like my words and deeds. The fragrance pervading the heavens’ blessed abodes is like my words and deeds being seen throughout the ten thousand li. The six paths hearing the fragrance and attaining liberation is like virtuous words and virtuous deeds being practiced in the world, benefiting all people and things.

This is the path of cultivation, its flavor savored by all living beings.

If one were to conjecture thus recklessly, the meaning would be obscured and the intent stifled.

The subject humbly hopes that the Most Exalted Sage will discern this, and that the world will believe it.

The subject speaks with utmost sincerity.

chunks.original_text: 尔时诸生天罪众既得生是胜天宫已，缘承慈光摄受之故，便自觉悟，各各明了罪福因缘，与诸眷属作天伎乐，来诣帝前。 是诸众等，各各含悲，俱发声言，前后经千劫万劫，不见三光，常处黑暗，三恶道中，多受苦恼。 伏蒙上帝方便放光，愍救我等，皆生天上。 是诸恶业，悉皆灭尽，无诸系滞，皆得往生。 仰朝上帝，各到道前。 是诸生天一切罪众说是语已，稽首复位。 右《承光觉悟章》，并已参校，略无舛误。 臣谨言曰：众生障重，业识昏迷，积恶累愆，至堕地狱。 彼时虽悔，将何及哉。 一旦忽受天恩，非但得脱苦趣，且获径生天宫，此之幸会，亿载一逢。 事出望外，其喜岂有涯际哉？ 今虽离苦得乐，实为庆幸，然不若在世之日直累善缘，径升乐地之为愈也。 世之众生，当勤种善果，勤求真道，毋俾既堕地狱，方觊天恩，以求解脱； 纵使天恩果得，则此身已受众苦，殊为可痛念也。 众生宜思之。 臣良谨言。 尔时玉帝出大妙音，普告十方诸天圣众：汝等谛听，此诸罪辈，旷劫以来，纵无明性，造十恶业，六尘徧染，三业萦缠，肆意任心，曾无觉悟，阴罪阳过，日积月深，背道违真，顺邪弃正，举心运念，动结愆尤，遂使命过之后，身落三途，不得解脱。 若非今日遇是法筵，何由出离？ 右《妙音开度章》并已详校，略无舛误。 惟是旧本，《妙音》一章，系在移接天人之后。 臣伏见玉帝分现之后，六起闻香解脱，承光觉悟，各了宿缘。 於是玉帝乃出妙音，再垂重训，以坚修进，然后移接天人，同现元始。 旧本以上真降传下仙，纪录次序颇紊。 臣今辄行迁证，庶获贯穿。 臣谨言曰：臣尝闻之经曰，生我者神，杀我者心。 故尝详味妙义，然后知心之为用，其为害与利、不可胜言也。 夫人生之初，特神之寓，未尝有是心也。 迨夫四大混合，神凝为心，心以神寓，即为离本矣。 心为离本，而心又生念，一念既着，则百为以生。 百为既生，则万罪万善，於是发萌矣。 是以斯念之起，适於善者，则功德以成； 适於恶者，则罪恶以就。 此无他，一心之生故也。 今观六趣之坠，初非系於别法之导指，特在举心运念之不纯，故愆尤之结，以至於三途久堕，不获超离。 若夫三业之萦，六尘之染，初非离於一心之生、一念之起也。 玉帝诞敷弘恩，接度诸趣，深恐诸趣承恩超离，根念未固，不能进修，特出妙音，为明沈沦之自，俾六趣灼识大本，不复迷沈。 是皆慈意恢洪，故屑屑不厌也。 俗世人民，当即帝之妙音，坚持禁戒，勿俾干犯，则升天证果，不啻反掌。 如或慢忽自纵，有拂妙音之戒，则沈落苦海，将犹立板而走丸，不可复反也。 毋谓帝恩之渥常可得之。 臣良谨言。

At that time, the assembled celestial beings and guilty multitudes, having already been reborn in this supreme celestial palace through the grace of compassionate light, spontaneously awakened and understood the karmic causes of sin and virtue. Together with their retinues, they performed celestial dances and presented themselves before the Emperor of Heaven.

These beings, each filled with sorrow, spoke aloud:
*"For countless kalpas—thousands upon thousands—we wandered without sight of the Three Lights, perpetually enshrouded in darkness within the Three Evil Paths, enduring endless suffering."*

By the Emperor’s compassionate grace, we were illuminated, rescued, and reborn in heaven. All our evil deeds have been utterly extinguished, our bonds severed, and we have attained rebirth.

We now prostrate before the Emperor and take our places at the Dao’s threshold.

After these celestial beings and guilty multitudes had spoken thus, they kowtowed and resumed their positions.

**Right: *The Chapter of Awakening Through Light’s Reception*, which has been carefully collated, contains no errors.**

The subject humbly states:
The multitudes of living beings are burdened with heavy obstructions, their karmic consciousness obscured by accumulated sins, plunging them into hell. Even if they repent then, what use is it?

Yet now, by sudden grace, we not only escape suffering but ascend directly to the celestial palace—a fortune encountered once in a hundred million kalpas! This joy, beyond all expectation, knows no bounds.

Though we have left suffering for bliss, it is still better to cultivate virtue in this world and ascend to the realm of joy directly. The living beings of this world should diligently sow good deeds, earnestly seek the True Dao, and not wait until they fall into hell to hope for heavenly mercy and seek liberation. Even if they attain it then, their bodies will have already endured countless sufferings—truly a cause for lamentation. The multitudes should reflect deeply upon this.

The subject speaks with utmost sincerity.

At that time, the Jade Emperor emitted a wondrous voice, addressing all the celestial saints of the ten directions:
*"Attend closely, you saints! These guilty ones, for eons past, though devoid of wisdom, committed the Ten Evils, their minds defiled by the Six Dusts, their threefold actions entangled. They acted at will, heedless of awakening, their hidden and manifest sins deepening daily. Abandoning the Dao and betraying Truth, they followed falsehood and rejected the right path. Every thought and impulse bound them further, so that after their lives ended, they fell into the Three Paths of woe, unable to escape.*

*Had they not encountered this Dharma feast today, how could they have freed themselves?"*

**Right: *The Chapter of the Wondrous Voice Opening Salvation*, which has been carefully collated, contains no errors.**

However, in the original text, *The Chapter of the Wondrous Voice* appears after the section where celestial beings are transferred and united. The subject observes that after the Jade Emperor’s manifestation in six forms—where the scent of liberation was heard, leading to awakening and the fulfillment of past karmic ties—he then emitted the wondrous voice to reinforce instruction before transferring and uniting the celestial beings with the Primordial Origin. The original sequence, where the Celestial Worthies descend and transmit the scriptures, is disordered.

The subject has thus rearranged and verified this, hoping to achieve coherence.

The subject humbly states:
The subject has heard in the scriptures: *"The spirit gives life, the heart takes it."* Thus, upon reflecting deeply on the profound meaning, one understands that the heart’s function brings both harm and benefit beyond measure.

At birth, humans are merely the abode of spirit, with no inherent heart. Only when the Four Great Elements coalesce does the spirit congeal into the heart, and as the heart houses the spirit, it becomes detached from its origin.

Once the heart is detached, it generates thoughts. A single thought, once rooted, gives rise to a hundred actions, and from a hundred actions, myriad sins and virtues sprout. Thus, when this thought aligns with goodness, merit is accomplished; when it aligns with evil, guilt is sealed. This is none other than the power of the single heart.

Now, observe the fall into the Six Realms: it was not due to external influences but arose from impure thoughts and actions, leading to karmic entanglements that plunged them into the Three Paths for endless ages, unable to transcend.

The Threefold Actions’ entanglements and the Six Dusts’ defilements stem not from anything outside the heart’s generation or the mind’s arising.

The Jade Emperor, in his boundless compassion, saves and guides all realms, fearing that though they may escape suffering through grace, their roots may not be steadfast enough for further cultivation. Thus, he emits the wondrous voice to clarify the nature of their former descent, so that all realms may recognize the Great Origin and no longer stray.

This is all from his merciful intent, vast and unwearied.

The common folk should heed the Emperor’s wondrous voice, uphold the precepts firmly, and avoid transgression. Only then can they ascend to heaven and attain fruition with ease. But if they grow negligent and disregard the precepts, they will sink into the sea of suffering—like trying to run on a tightrope while rolling a ball, with no return possible.

Do not presume that the Emperor’s grace is always attainable.

The subject speaks with utmost sincerity.

This is the path of cultivation, its flavor savored by all living beings.

If one were to conjecture thus recklessly, the meaning would be obscured and the intent stifled.

chunks.original_text: 尔时诸天化身上帝□即以神通，不动其所，接移天人，皆令得至清微天宫玉清圣境元始会下，是诸等众，不觉不知。 是时天尊众会，见是十方玉帝化身普皆来集，天尊会前，如无边明镜，照诸影像，互相容入。 时诸大众，稽首瞻仰。 上帝化身，圣中最雄，增长清信，益加志乐，心无退转，起大坚固。 时诸天人，迩得生天，忽睹天尊胜会道场，清净第一，无为功德之所庄严，踊跃欢喜，一时作礼，叹未曾有。 294 右《移接天人章》，并已参校，略无舛误。 臣谨言曰：法性平等，广大无量，增之不益，削之不欠，近之不迩，远之不遐。 曰圣曰真，曰天曰人，初未尝有异也。 奈何众生具体，离本去原，毫厘一差，千里之谬。 是以崇卑顿异，凡圣迥殊，彼此相窥，亿万有间。 今玉帝覃恩，度移苦趣，皆俾超升，虽妙音之出，为明罪本，既详且尽，然犹虑诸趣未体法性之妙，故现异境，示以法性无碍之实。 故不动其所，移接天人，俾至元始会下。 自诸天而观，则元始之会远在极尊之域，自元始会下而观，则诸天之境亦远在至卑之地。 今玉帝不动其所，俾诸天元始之境，如指掌中，瞭然在目。 岂非法性妙用，天人一理，崇卑一致哉。 修学之士宜即《移接》一章，参味玄奥，则性中天地、心内圣凡，和会混融，广博无碍。 是不特下仙修证之比也。 道不负人，宜加勤焉。 臣良谨言。

At that time, the Heavenly Ones transformed into the Emperor of the Dao, who immediately, through divine power, did not alter his own place but transported all the celestial beings and humans to the **Yusheng Palace** of the **Jingming Pure Realm**, the gathering beneath the **Yuan Shi** (Primordial Origin). These multitudes were unaware and did not know.

At that moment, the Heavenly Sovereign presided over the assembly, seeing the **Yushi** (Jade Emperors) of the Ten Directions—all transformed bodies—come together. Before the assembly, the Heavenly Sovereign appeared like a boundless mirror, reflecting all their forms, each interpenetrating the others.

Then the great assembly bowed in reverence and gazed upward.

Among the transformed bodies of the Jade Emperor, the **Saintly Central One** was the most majestic, fostering pure faith, strengthening resolve, and filling their hearts with joy, leaving no trace of retreat. His firm and unshakable spirit arose.

Now, the celestial beings and humans, who had recently ascended to heaven, suddenly beheld the Heavenly Sovereign’s sublime gathering and the Dao-field, pristine and unparalleled, adorned with the **virtue of non-action**. They leapt in delight, all offering homage at once, exclaiming that they had never before witnessed such splendor.

The above *"Chapter of Transplanting and Connecting Celestial Beings and Humans"* has been cross-referenced and verified; there are no discrepancies.

The subject respectfully declares:
The **nature of the Law (dharma)** is equal and boundless, neither increased by addition nor diminished by subtraction. It is not distant when approached nor remote when viewed from afar. The terms **Saint**, **True**, **Heaven**, and **Human** were never originally distinct.

Yet how is it that living beings, embodied and concrete, stray from their origin and source? Even a hair’s breadth of deviation leads to error a thousand miles wide.

Thus, high and low are suddenly divided, and the common and the Saintly are utterly distinct. Though they may perceive each other, they remain separated by a vast chasm.

Now the Jade Emperor, out of profound grace, **transplants** and **connects** those of suffering realms, elevating them all. Though the wondrous voice was emitted to clarify the roots of their offenses—both detailed and thorough—he still feared that the beings of all realms had not yet comprehended the subtleties of the **Law-nature**. Therefore, he manifested a different realm to demonstrate the **unobstructed reality of the Law-nature**.

Hence, without altering his own place, he transplanted and connected the celestial beings to the Yuan Shi gathering. From the perspective of the celestial beings, the Yuan Shi gathering lay far within the **ultimate exalted domain**. From the Yuan Shi gathering’s standpoint, the celestial realms appeared distant in the **most humble abode**.

Now, the Jade Emperor, unmoved in his own place, brings the celestial beings and the Yuan Shi realm within reach—like the finger and palm—clearly visible before their eyes.

Is this not the **mysterious operation of the Law-nature**, where heaven and humans share a single principle, and high and low are in perfect accord?

Aspiring scholars should study the *"Chapter of Transplanting and Connecting"* with deep reflection, savoring its profound mysteries. Then, within their own nature, the harmony of heaven and earth, and within their own hearts, the unity of the Saintly and the common, will merge and blend, boundless in their breadth.

This is not merely a comparison for those who seek to cultivate and verify the Dao below the immortals.

The Dao does not fail humanity; one should only redouble their diligence.

The subject, **Liang**, speaks with utmost sincerity.

chunks.original_text: 尔时十方诸化玉皇□俱复一体，从法席起，向北长跪。 天尊言曰：往昔去世，有国名号光严妙乐，其国王者名曰净德。 时王有后，名宝月光。 其王无嗣。 帝□因一日作是思惟：我今将老，而无太子，身或崩灭□，社稷九庙，委付何人？ 作是念已，即便敕下诏诸道众於诸宫殿，依诸科教，悬诸旛盖，清净严洁，广陈供养，六时行道，徧祷真圣。 已经半载，不退初心。 忽夜宝月光皇后梦太上道君与诸至真，金姿玉质，清净之俦，驾五色龙舆，拥耀景旌，荫明霞盖，是时太上道君安坐龙舆，抱一婴儿，身诸毛孔放百亿光，照诸宫殿，作百宝色，幢节前导，浮空而来。 是时皇后心生欢喜，恭敬接礼，长跪道前，白道君言：今王无嗣，愿乞此子为社稷主。 伏愿慈悲，哀愍听许。 尔时道君答皇后言：愿特赐汝。 是时皇后礼谢道君，而乃收之。 皇后收已，便从梦归，觉而有孕。 怀胎一年，于丙午岁正月九日午时诞于王宫。 当生之时，身宝光焰，充满王国，色相妙好，观者无厌。 幼而敏慧，长而慈善□，于其国中所有库藏、一切财宝，尽将散施穷乏困苦、鳏寡孤独、无所依估、饥馑癃残一切众生，仁爱和逊，歌谣有道，化及遐方，天下仰从，归仁太子，父王加庆。 当尔之后，王忽告崩，太子治政，俯念浮生，告敕大臣，嗣位有道。 遂舍其国，於普明香严山中修道，功成超度。 过是劫已，历八百劫，身常舍其国，为群生故，割爱学道。 於此后经八百劫，行药治病，拯救众生，令其安乐。 此劫尽已，又历八百劫，广行方便，启诸道藏，演说灵章，恢宣正化，敷扬神功，助国救人，自幽及显。 过此已后，再历八百劫，亡身损命，行忍辱故，舍己血肉。 如是修行三千二百劫，始证金仙，号曰清净自然觉王如来，教诸菩萨顿悟大乘正宗，渐入虚无妙道。 如是修行，又经亿劫，始证玉帝。 说是语已，法筵清众异口同声，叹未曾有。 右《化生本行章》，并已参校，略无舛误。 臣谨言曰：无上大因缘、大功德，自无始以来，未有如玉帝化生一事也。 天尊为是因缘功德，特建微妙道场，显示三界。 是以先俾玉帝放光，现大神化，然后敷宣秘密，详述化生本行。 故玉帝於移接天人之后，自分而合，返本还元，现无上道身，上朝元始，朝谒之时，初未尝出一语以白天尊也。 天尊玉帝，心光混融，非一非二。 故玉帝北向，跪奉朝仪，而金口妙言，即宣本行。 自今观之，以帝身而分现诸天，即真一应化也； 以分现诸身而合为一体，即真一不动也。 天尊建微妙道场，是欲宣演大因缘功德也。 金口宣演化生本行，是欲俾三界万生知玉帝因缘功德之大而仿效进修也。 真一不二法门，即此是也； 清净解脱之道，亦此是也。 含生宜现玉帝化生修累之事，而勉建无上之玄功，则功德巍巍也。 又观玉帝自一而分，自分而一，则可以造真一不二之门而成无上道也。 傥能不惮辛苦，自一时以至於四时，自一年以至於百年，自一生以至於多生，自一劫以至於亿劫，坚勤不退，则凡身浊质，离垢成真，大弥罗天当为汝铺张分位，俾汝登证也。 列侍三境，进事玉帝，又奚难矣哉。 含生及修行之士，宜谛思之。 臣良谨言。 尔时众中有一玉女，名曰夜光，从座而起，严整衣冠，从容雅步，长跪道前，白天尊言：臣宿昔何幸，仰侍御前，亲奉供养，已经亿劫。

At that time, the Ten Directions’ **transcendent sovereigns of all transformations** (化玉皇) and the **Celestial Lord** (天尊) all merged into one body. Rising from the **Law Assembly** (法席), they knelt facing north.

The **Celestial Lord** spoke: *"In the past, after departing from this world, there was a realm called Radiant and Pure Auspicious Joy (光严妙乐). Its king was named Pure Virtue (净德). The king had a queen named Precious Moonlight (宝月光). Yet the king had no heir. One day, I pondered thus: ‘Now that I am aging, and there is no crown prince, when my body perishes, who will inherit the ancestral temples and the state?’

Having formed this thought, I immediately issued decrees to all **Daoist assemblies** (道众) across the palaces, ordering them to follow the established **rites and teachings** (科教), to hoist the **auspicious banners and canopies** (旛盖), to maintain purity and solemnity, to array offerings in abundance, and to perform **six-period Daoist rites** (六时行道), praying earnestly to the **True and Holy Saints** (真圣). After half a year, without wavering in my initial resolve, suddenly in the night, Queen Precious Moonlight dreamed of the **Supreme Dao Lord** (太上道君) and the **Assemblies of the Most Perfect** (诸至真), whose forms were golden and jade-like, a pair of pure and radiant beings. They rode a **five-colored dragon chariot** (五色龙舆), surrounded by **glowing banners and luminous flags** (耀景旌), sheltered beneath **resplendent cloud canopies** (明霞盖). At that moment, the **Supreme Dao Lord** sat serenely in the chariot, cradling an infant whose body emitted a hundred billion rays of light from every pore, illuminating all the palaces in a myriad of **treasure hues** (百宝色). The **standards and banners** (幢节) led the way, floating through the air.

The queen’s heart filled with joy, and she reverently received the infant, kneeling in homage before the **Supreme Dao Lord** and saying: ‘The king has no heir. I humbly beg You to grant this child as the sovereign of our realm. May You, in Your boundless compassion, pity and permit my wish.’

The **Supreme Dao Lord** replied to the queen: ‘I shall specially bestow him upon you.’

The queen then bowed in gratitude to the **Supreme Dao Lord** and took the child. Upon awakening from the dream, she conceived. After a year of gestation, in the **Year of the Dragon-Horse (丙午)**, on the **ninth day of the first month at noon**, she gave birth to the prince in the royal palace.

At the time of his birth, his body blazed with **treasure-like light** (宝光焰), filling the entire kingdom. His appearance was wondrous and exquisite; all who beheld him were captivated.

As a youth, he was **quick-witted and insightful**; as he grew, he became **compassionate and benevolent**. Within his realm, he took all stored treasures and every kind of wealth and distributed them to the **impoverished and suffering**, the **widowed, orphaned, and solitary**, those **without refuge**, and all **starving, diseased, and crippled beings**. His **mercy and harmony** (仁爱和逊) were boundless, and the songs of the people praised him. His influence extended to distant lands; all under heaven revered and followed him. The prince was called **Return-to-Ren** (归仁太子), and his father rejoiced.

After this, the king suddenly passed away, and the prince ascended the throne. Bowing to the fleeting nature of life, he proclaimed to his ministers: ‘The succession must follow the **Dao**.’

Thus, he abandoned his kingdom and retreated to **Universal Clarity Auspicious Joy Mountain** (普明香严山) to cultivate the **Dao**. His practice reached fruition, and he transcended.

Following this, he passed through **eight hundred kalpas** (劫), always relinquishing his kingdom for the sake of all beings, **severing his attachments** to pursue **Daoist cultivation** (学道). Afterward, for another **eight hundred kalpas**, he practiced **medicinal arts** (行药), healing the sick and rescuing beings, making them **secure and content**.

When that kalpa ended, he again traversed **eight hundred kalpas**, employing **skillful means** (方便), opening the **Daoist treasure repositories** (道藏), expounding **sacred scriptures** (灵章), and **proclaiming the true transformation** (正化). He **extolled the divine powers** (神功), aiding realms and saving people—from the **hidden to the manifest**.

After this, for another **eight hundred kalpas**, he **endured suffering and humiliation** (忍辱), **sacrificing his own flesh and blood** (舍己血肉) for the sake of his practice.

Thus, he cultivated for **three thousand two hundred kalpas** before attaining the **Golden Immortal** (金仙) stage, named **Pure and Natural Awakening Sovereign Thus-Come** (清净自然觉王如来). He taught all **bodhisattvas** (菩萨) the **sudden insight into the Great Vehicle’s true essence** (顿悟大乘正宗) and guided them into the **progressive path of the Mysterious Dao of Emptiness** (渐入虚无妙道).

Having cultivated further for **a hundred million kalpas**, he finally attained the **Celestial Sovereign** (玉帝) stage.

Having spoken thus, the **Law Assembly’s pure congregation** (法筵清众) in unison exclaimed: *"Such a marvel has never been heard before!"*

This is the **"Chapter of the Transformation and Birth"** (化生本行章), which has now been cross-verified and contains no errors.

I, your subject **Liang**, humbly state: *"The **Supreme Cause and Effect** (无上大因缘) and **Supreme Virtue** (大功德), since the beginningless past, have never been as vast as the Celestial Sovereign’s transformation and birth.*

The **Celestial Lord** (天尊) established this **subtle Daoist site** (微妙道场) to **display the Three Realms** (三界), desiring to **proclaim the great cause and virtue**. Therefore, He first caused the **Celestial Sovereign** (玉帝) to manifest light, **revealing the grand transformation** (大神化), before **expounding the secrets** (秘密) and **detailed the origins of the Transformation and Birth** (化生本行).

Thus, after the **Celestial Sovereign** demonstrated the **transplanting and connecting of heaven and humans** (移接天人), He **divided and merged** (自分而合), **returned to the origin and restored the root** (返本还元), **manifesting the Supreme Dao Body** (无上道身). When paying homage to the **Primordial Sovereign** (元始), during the audience, He never once spoke a word to the **Celestial Lord** (天尊).

The **Celestial Lord** and the **Celestial Sovereign** (玉帝) share a **single luminous mind** (心光), **neither one nor two**. Hence, the **Celestial Sovereign** faced north and knelt in homage, and the **Golden Mouth’s wondrous speech** (金口妙言) directly proclaimed the **Transformation and Birth**.

Observing this today, when the **Celestial Sovereign’s body** (帝身) **divides to manifest all the heavens** (分现诸天), it is the **True One’s universal transformation** (真一应化). When these **divided manifestations** (分现诸身) **merge into unity** (合为一体), it is the **True One’s immovable essence** (真一不动).

The **Celestial Lord’s** establishment of this **subtle Daoist site** is to **proclaim the great cause and virtue**. The **Golden Mouth’s proclamation** of the **Transformation and Birth** is to **let all beings of the Three Realms know the vastness of the Celestial Sovereign’s cause and virtue**, so they may emulate and cultivate accordingly.

The **True One’s Non-dual Path** (真一不二法门) is this; the **Pure and Liberated Dao** (清净解脱之道) is also this.

All beings should **contemplate the Celestial Sovereign’s Transformation and Birth**, and **strive to build the Supreme Mysterious Merit** (无上之玄功), so that their **virtue may be towering and vast** (功德巍巍).

Again, observe how the **Celestial Sovereign** **divides from unity** (自一而分) and **merges back into unity** (自分而一). Thus, one may **enter the True Non-dual Path** (造真一不二之门) and **attain the Supreme Dao** (成无上道).

If one **endures no hardship**, from **a single moment** (自一时) to **the four seasons** (以至於四时), from **a single year** (自一年以至於百年) to **a hundred years**, from **a single lifetime** (自一生) to **many lifetimes**, from **a single kalpa** (自一劫) to **a hundred million kalpas**, with **unyielding diligence**, then even the **coarse and impure body** (凡身浊质) may **shed defilement and become true** (离垢成真). The **Great Maitreya Heaven** (大弥罗天) will **prepare the way for your ascent** (铺张分位), allowing you to **attain realization** (登证).

With the **Three Realms’ attendants** (列侍三境) serving and approaching the **Celestial Sovereign**, what further difficulty could there be?

All beings and those who cultivate should **ponder this deeply**. I, your subject **Liang**, humbly state.

At that time, a **jewel maiden** (玉女) from the assembly named **Moonlight** (夜光) arose from her seat, **adjusting her attire** (严整衣冠) and **composing her steps** (从容雅步). Kneeling before the **Celestial Lord**, she said: *"I, your subject, have been fortunate in the past to serve You in person, offering reverent and sincere homage. This has spanned a hundred million kalpas."*

chunks.original_text: 三清境界，金阙玉京，寂淡逍遥，快乐自在，嬉游圣域，餐听法音，未曾见此希有之事。 不审向来光内所现十方诸天变现圣境皆有上帝应化法身□，天真大圣、妙行真人、灵妃玉女以侍卫，是诸玉女，相貌端严，形体殊妙，无与等者。 复蒙上帝神通移接，今皆普集在清微天，未审今此玉女以何因缘，得证如是无上色身？ 思惟圣慈，示以未悟。 尔时天尊谓夜光玉女言：汝固初入圣流，虽有智慧，未能明了。 此诸玉女，乃自往昔无量劫中，修诸妙行，具解脱门，同清净信，同净净解，同清净念，同清净行，同清净身，同清净心，同清净意，同清净果，同清净报，同大慈心，同大悲心，覆护众生，如母抚念，爱於赤子，奉戒专一，冥心大道，清斋弘誓，千万劫中尊奉玉帝。 此诸玉女，非实是女，皆天至真，为度拿生，现玉女身。 是故身色、神通、智慧，隐显变化，与帝同焉。 尔时夜光闻是说已，心得开悟，稽首欢喜，默然复位。 右《玉女妙行章》，并已参校，略无舛误。 臣谨言曰：诊云，人不知身为圣，马不知身为龙。 诚哉，是言也。 夫玉女之身，纯阴之质也。 纯阴近乎浊，宜乎进修之难於清净也。 今玉女以其修诸妙行，遂能具解脱门。 夫所谓具云者，无所不解脱也。 然原其所以具解脱门之自，则始於修诸妙行，而妙行之修，又根本於大慈大悲之心，与夫所信所解，曰念曰行，曰身曰心，曰意，并由清净，故其果其报，莫不清净，以至於解脱之具焉。 吁，玉女阴浊之身，能慈悲清净，修诸妙行，而能至於解脱，仰侍玉帝，且又身色、神通、智慧，隐显变化，与帝一同，甚而至於俾六道苦趣，闻其身香，而亦臻解脱，则妙行之修，其功德果报，一何崇大广博也哉。 斯世之人，凡受中禀气，皆自元始，初未尝异於玉女也。 苟能修诸妙行，俾与玉女不异，则后之起证，又焉与玉女异哉？ 含生宜黾勉，仿此而修之。 若夫前章言玉帝为十方之众演说清净解脱之道，即此是也。 玉帝有不言之言，并宜思之。 臣良谨言。 尔时高虚清明天主与诸天眷属驭八景鸾舆，荫□九光宝盖，奏玄歌妙乐，咏无量洞章，散天宝花，喷天真香，飞步游空，来诣道前。 承天尊上帝□威神之力，是诸宝花即於空中化一宝盖，荫覆大众，无不周徧。 是时高虚清明天主见此希有，稽首长跪，白天尊上帝言：贱臣懈怠，后会法筵。 今日吉庆，兴此法桥，幽显凡圣，普沾圣泽，放大光明，现希有相，上照诸天、四梵六欲一切乐土，诸真圣众睹此光明？ 皆悉云集，下照十方无极世界，同玄都境，近接九天，灵风奏乐，宫商相和，激朗云庭，皆成洞章。 一切众生，咸臻道化。 酆都铁围、长夜九幽、一切地狱受苦众生，尽承光力，皆生诸天，得受快乐。 令臣所散天宝奇花，旋结成盖，徧覆大众，尽乃□斯光威神之力。 臣等千劫良因，九天运会，皇道荡荡，正法兴隆，今日大吉，咸仰玄功。 是时高虚清明天主以偈赞上帝曰□： 金阙玄穹祖，高上玉皇尊。 妙相冠诸天，慈光烛三界。 真圣妙道师，天人依仗师。 大乘垂法语，真一指迷徒。 功德若虚空，赞扬无穷尽。 是穹苍主浩劫之尊，妙见妙知，无等无伦，湛寂真净，杳亡杳存，上圣上灵，大神通，光明藏，大丈夫，开化人天，教道无穷，大慈大悲，流焕法轮，为度群生，是号玉皇。

The **Three Pure Ones’ realm**—golden palaces, jade capitals—where stillness and serenity reign, unbounded freedom and joyous ease prevail. Within the sacred domain, they dine on the sounds of **dharma**, yet never before have they witnessed such a rare and wondrous sight.

I do not know how, within the luminous **Dao**, the **Ten Directions’ celestial beings** manifest their sacred forms, all bearing the **Celestial Sovereign’s transformed **dharma-body**□. The **Heavenly Pure Ones**, **Mystic Conduct Immortals**, and **Spiritual Consorts** attend as guardians. These **jewel maidens**, their features noble and refined, their forms exquisitely wondrous, surpass all comparison.

Further, by the **Celestial Sovereign’s divine power**, they are now all gathered in the **Pure Vacuity Heaven**. I do not know by what cause and condition this **jewel maiden** has attained such a supreme **color-body**?

Reflecting on the **Celestial Lord’s** boundless compassion, He enlightens me to my unenlightened state. Then the **Celestial Lord** spoke to the **Moonlight Jewel Maiden**, saying:

*"You have only recently entered the sacred **Dao-flow**. Though wise, you do not yet comprehend fully. These **jewel maidens**—from countless kalpas past, they cultivated **mystic conduct**, mastered the **gates of liberation**, shared **pure faith**, **pure understanding**, **pure mindfulness**, **pure conduct**, **pure body**, **pure heart**, **pure intention**, **pure fruit**, and **pure retribution**. They possessed **great compassion** and **great pity**, sheltering all beings as a mother cherishes her child, loving them as her own. They upheld the precepts with singular devotion, their minds immersed in the **Great Dao**, observing strict **vegetarian abstinence** and taking grand vows. For countless kalpas, they reverently served the **Jade Emperor**.

These **jewel maidens** are not truly women—they are **Heaven’s utmost purity**, manifesting as **jewel maidens** to rescue sentient beings. Thus, their **bodies, colors, divine powers, and wisdom**—whether hidden or revealed—are in harmony with the **Celestial Sovereign’s**.

When **Moonlight** heard this, her heart opened in enlightenment. She bowed in joy and returned to her seat in silence.

**Right, the *Chapter of the Jewel Maiden’s Mystic Conduct***, having been cross-verified, contains no errors. Your subject humbly states:

It is said, *"Man does not know his body is sacred; a horse does not know his body is a dragon."* Truly, these words are profound.

The **jewel maiden’s** body is of **pure yin** essence. **Pure yin** is close to impurity, and thus it is fitting that her path to **purity** is arduous. Yet now, through cultivating **mystic conduct**, she has mastered the **gates of liberation**. By *"mastered"* is meant **liberation from all bonds**.

But tracing the root of her attainment—it began with cultivating **mystic conduct**, and **mystic conduct** itself stems from **great compassion and great pity**, along with her **faith, understanding, mindfulness, conduct, body, heart, and intention**—all purified. Thus, her **fruit and retribution** are without exception pure, leading to **complete liberation**.

Ah! A **jewel maiden** of **yin’s impure** nature, yet able to cultivate **compassion and purity**, to practice **mystic conduct**, and attain **liberation**, serving the **Jade Emperor**—and further, her **body, colors, divine powers, and wisdom** hidden or revealed, all in harmony with the **Celestial Sovereign’s**—even to the point where beings of the **Six Realms**, upon smelling her **body-scent**, also attain liberation! How vast and boundless are the **merits and retributions** of **mystic conduct**!

All beings in this world, endowed with **original qi** from the **Primordial Beginning**, were never inherently different from these **jewel maidens**. If one cultivates **mystic conduct** to match theirs, how could their future **realization** differ?

All living beings should strive earnestly, emulating this path. As for the earlier chapter where the **Jade Emperor** expounded the **Dao of pure liberation** to the **Ten Directions**, this is precisely it. The **Jade Emperor’s** unsaid words should also be pondered.

Your subject **Liang** humbly states:

At that time, the **High Void, Pure Clarity Heavenly Sovereign**, with celestial attendants, rode the **Eight Auspicious Celestial Chariot**, sheltered beneath the **Nine-Light Jewel Umbrella**, playing **mysterious songs** and **wondrous music**, reciting **infinite sacred verses**, scattering **heavenly treasure flowers** and **Heaven’s True Fragrance**. They flew through the air, arriving before the **Dao**.

By the **Celestial Sovereign’s** mighty **威神** (awe-inspiring spirit-power), these **treasure flowers** transformed in midair into a **jewel umbrella**, sheltering all beneath its vast canopy without omission.

Seeing this rare spectacle, the **High Void, Pure Clarity Heavenly Sovereign** bowed deeply and knelt, reporting to the **Celestial Sovereign**:

*"Your humble subject was negligent in attending the **dharma-assembly** at our last meeting. Today’s auspicious celebration has raised this **dharma-bridge**, benefiting both **mortal and immortal**, **common and sacred**, all bathing in the **Celestial Grace**. The radiant light shines forth, manifesting a **rare form**, illuminating the **Ten Directions**, the **Four Heavenly Kings**, the **Six Desires**, and all **lands of bliss**. The **true and sacred assemblies** witnessing this light all gather in response. Below, it illuminates the **Ten Directions’ boundless worlds**, aligning with the **Mysterious Capital**, approaching the **Nine Heavens**, where **spirit winds** play music, harmonizing **pitch and tone**, resounding through the **cloud courts**, all forming **sacred verses**.

All beings attain **Dao-transformation**. Even the **Yin Valley Iron Enclosure**, the **Eternal Night Nine Abysses**, and all tormented beings in the **Six Realms of Hell**—all receive the light’s power and are reborn in the heavens, experiencing joy.

Your subject’s scattered **heavenly treasure flowers** swiftly coalesce into this umbrella, covering all beneath its **awe-inspiring spirit-power**. Your subjects’ **thousand-kalpa merits** have now ripened, the **Nine Heavens’ destiny fulfilled**, the **Royal Dao** vast and unobstructed, the **True Teaching** flourishing. Today’s great auspiciousness is universally acknowledged for its **mysterious virtues**.

At that time, the **High Void, Pure Clarity Heavenly Sovereign** praised the **Celestial Sovereign** with this **gāthā**:

*"Golden **jiao-gate**, the **Primordial Ancestor** of the **Heavenly Vault**,
The **Exalted Jade Emperor**, most honored.
His **mystic form** surpasses all heavens,
His **compassionate light** illuminates the **Three Realms**.
The **True and Sacred** **Dao-Master** of **mystic vision**,
Heaven and man alike rely on him as their guide.
With **Great Vehicle teachings**, he points out the lost,
The **One True Principle** revealed to all.
His **merits and virtues** are boundless as the void,
Praise for him is endless and inexhaustible.
This **Heavenly Sovereign** of the **Vault’s expanse**—
His **mystic vision** and **mystic knowledge** are unmatched,
Without equal or peer, serene and pure,
Fathomless in presence, yet ever-present,
The **Supreme Sage**, the **Supreme Spirit**,
Possessing **great divine power**, the **Light-Treasury**,
A **Great Man** who opens the **Dao** for **heaven and earth**,
His teachings endless, his **great compassion** and **great pity** flowing,
He turns the **dharma-wheel**, rescuing all beings—
Thus is he named the **Jade Emperor."*

chunks.original_text: 穹苍真老，妙圆清净，智慧辩才，至道至尊，开度众生，故演□是光。 右《天主赞仰章》，并已参校，略无舛误。 臣谨言曰：玉帝功德之大，言辞不可赞也，譬喻不可尽也。 虽以尘沙界中无量天人，身具万舌，美之赞之，皆不可穷，况以一人之舌赞美之哉。 今高虚清明天主以偈赞叹，是盖恐三界万生，犹有未知玉帝之功德者也。 模仿阴阳之真形，绘画日月之神光，虽良工决不可以用其巧，矧帝之功德崇大广博，容可言扬哉。 虽然，天主之偈美则美矣，至则至矣，虽犹未足以形容帝德之万一矣，然天主之意，盖欲托此而启金口无尽之言。 故偈颂称赞，不辞缕复。 天尊察知其诚，故於后章继有圣训云。 臣良谨言。 尔时高虚清明天主说偈赞叹已，天尊普告四众云：是帝身即道身也，非常体也。 是无量功德之身，是清净自然之身，是神明坚固不坏真空无上法身。 威灵恢廓，名声周徧，无幽不开，神奇堂堂，难可称焉。 是帝非有为功德之所熏修，而帝昔虽下生人间，多劫行化，示大神通而身清净，未尝不在金阙分身变化，应现随方，利济群生，超升道岸，普垂教法，开悟后人，依按奉行，登真成道。 以斯功德之所庄严，是故光明常充诸天，神智妙达，莫可度量。 是身光明，皆具妙号，所谓大神通光，大慈悲光，大喜舍光，大忍辱光，大平等光，大柔和光，大自在光，大利益光，大如意光，大智慧光，大吉祥光，大解脱光，大归依光，大功德光，大圆满光，大无碍光，无能胜光。 是故汝等欲见是帝，乃不可得者，缘以汝等尚於身口不舍结习，烦恼行业，由是障故，不能得睹是帝慈颜。 吾今为汝时会众等，宣示断障之法，汝等大众，各宜奉行。 时诸大众不胜喜跃，各于至尊几前，稽首作礼，俱欲愿闻。 天尊言曰：断障之法，当生大悲，无起疑惑，无起贪嗔，无起淫欲，无起嫉妬，无起杀害，无起凡情，无起凡思，无起贪妬，无起声色，无起是非，无起憎爱，无起分别，无起高慢，无起执着，凝神澄虑，万神调伏，心若太虚，内外贞白，无所不容，无所不纳，无令外邪乱其至道，牵失真宗，败其灵根，盗其至宝，致尔万劫永堕凡流，透入俗网，万魔来攻，百千万劫，不闻妙法，鬼神执诛，从生入死。 是故汝等应当志心，善护真宗，无令丧失。 如前所说，如是诸障，汝等各各当除断之，身得清净，超度诸难，是名道宝，持法楝梁。 更当修奉是此经典，如近是帝，生尊重心，着想尊容，称扬名号，然后汝等得睹慈颜，咸蒙护度，普闻妙法，亲奉供养，永无流转。 是时四众闻已欢喜，叹未曾有。 右《垂教断阵章》，并已参校，略无舛误。 臣谨言曰：经者，径也，修行之路也。 凡人奉经，有二法门：一曰口诵，一曰心持。 口诵者，谓以口业称扬也； 心持者，谓以意业遵行也。 口诵者当以心持为本，心持者当以口诵为先，心口相资，功德乃就。 举一废一，功德不成。 故经中合言诵持也。 诵而不持，是言譊饶而心无益也； 持而不诵，是心虽动而意不达也。 是必二者并举，事乃成焉。 此诵持之说也。 若夫诵持玉帝之经，是当遵行帝之功德，仿慕帝之修证而后可也。 遵行仿慕，有五法门：一曰尊重景慕，二曰忏断障业，三曰积功利济，四曰含容明通，五曰真一变化。
chunks.translated_text:
「The **Vault’s True Elder**,
In **wondrous perfection**, pure and clear,
With **wisdom and eloquence** unparalleled,
The **Supreme Dao/Way**, the **Supreme Sovereign**,
He opens and liberates all beings—
Thus he performs this **light** of **manifestation**.

Here ends the *Ode of Praise to the Heavenly Sovereign*, which has been cross-verified and contains no discrepancies.
The humble servant respectfully states:
The **Jade Emperor’s** merits and virtues are vast—
Words cannot fully praise them,
Nor analogies exhaust their grandeur.
Even if all beings in the **sandhi-world**,
With countless tongues, extol and beautify him,
They could never exhaust his praise—
How much more so with one mortal tongue!

Now, the **High Void’s** clear and luminous Heavenly Sovereign is extolled in this **gatha**,
For fear that beings in the **Three Realms** might yet remain unaware of the Emperor’s **merits and virtues**.
Though skilled artisans could imitate the true forms of **Yin and Yang**,
And depict the divine radiance of sun and moon,
Even the finest craftsman could not fully employ his artistry—
How much more impossible to exhaust the Emperor’s **virtue/power**, lofty and boundless in scope?

Though this **gatha** is beautiful and profound,
It still falls short of capturing even a fraction of the Emperor’s **virtue/power**,
Yet the Heavenly Sovereign’s intent is to use this as a pretext
To inspire the **endless teachings** of the **Golden Mouth**.

Thus, the **gatha** of praise and extolment
Does not hesitate to repeat itself in detail.
The **Heavenly Sovereign** perceives their sincerity,
And so, in the following chapter, continues with **sacred instruction**:

*"Thus the humble servant speaks with reverence.
At that time, the **High Void’s** clear and luminous Heavenly Sovereign,
Having delivered the **gatha** of praise and extolment,
Turned to the **Four Assemblies** and declared:
This Emperor’s **body** is the **Dao-body**,
Not an ordinary form.
This is the **body of boundless merit**,
The **body of pure, natural clarity**,
The **immutable, unshakable, supreme, true, and empty Law-body** of divine intelligence.
His **mystic aura** and **mystic presence** are vast and unconfined,
His **name** resounds throughout the **Ten Directions**,
No darkness remains unilluminated,
His **divine marvels** are resplendent and awe-inspiring—
Beyond all measure or description.

This Emperor’s **body** is not the result of **conditional merit**,
Nor does it arise from cultivation through **deliberate action**.
Though in past **kalpas** he descended to the mortal realm,
He demonstrated the **Great Divine Power** while maintaining his **pure body**,
Never ceasing to **manifest in the Jade Vault**,
To **multiply his forms** and **adapt to all regions**,
To benefit all beings, elevate them beyond the **worldly shore**,
And universally propagate the **teachings of the Dao/Way**,
Enlightening future generations,
Guiding them in **faithful practice**,
And helping them attain **True Reality** and the **Dao/Way**.
Through these **merits and virtues** of **ornamentation**,
His **light** perpetually fills the heavens,
His **divine intelligence** penetrates all mysteries—
Beyond all calculation or comprehension.

This **body’s light** possesses **wondrous names**,
Such as the **Light of Great Divine Power**,
The **Light of Great Compassion and Great Pity**,
The **Light of Great Joy and Renunciation**,
The **Light of Great Endurance and Great Forbearance**,
The **Light of Great Equanimity**,
The **Light of Great Gentleness and Harmony**,
The **Light of Great Freedom and Great Sovereignty**,
The **Light of Great Benefit**,
The **Light of Great Fulfillment**,
The **Light of Great Wisdom**,
The **Light of Great Auspiciousness**,
The **Light of Great Liberation**,
The **Light of Great Refuge**,
The **Light of Great Merit**,
The **Light of Great Perfection**,
The **Light of Great Unobstructedness**—
A **light** none can surpass.

Thus, you who wish to behold this Emperor
Cannot do so—
For you still cling to **impure actions** of **body, speech, and mind**,
To **afflictions** and **worldly deeds**,
Which obstruct your vision,
Preventing you from seeing the Emperor’s **compassionate face**.

Now, for you who gather here,
I proclaim the **Law of Clearing Obstacles**—
You must all diligently follow it.
At that moment, the **Four Assemblies** rejoiced beyond measure,
Each prostrated before the **Supreme Sovereign’s** seat,
Bowed in homage,
And eagerly wished to hear more.

The **Heavenly Sovereign** spoke:
*"The **Law of Clearing Obstacles** requires
The generation of **Great Compassion**,
No **doubt or confusion**,
No **greed or anger**,
No **lustful desire**,
No **jealousy or envy**,
No **harm or malice**,
No **worldly attachments**,
No **worldly thoughts**,
No **greed or envy**,
No **infatuation with sounds and colors**,
No **clinging to right or wrong**,
No **hatred or love**,
No **discrimination**,
No **arrogance**,
No **fixation**—
Concentrate your **mind**, purify your **thoughts**,
Subdue all **spirits** within,
Your **heart** as boundless as the **Great Void**,
Inner and outer **purity** untainted,
Accepting all without exclusion,
Receiving all without reservation—
Never allowing external **evil forces** to disrupt your **Supreme Dao/Way**,
To drag you away from **True Reality**,
To destroy your **divine essence**,
To steal your **supreme treasures**,
Or to condemn you to **endless kalpas** of **worldly existence**,
To sink into the **netherworld’s snares**,
Where **myriad demons** assail you,
And for **hundreds of thousands of kalpas**
You hear no **mystic teachings**,
Suffer **torment by ghosts and spirits**,
And wander from life to death.

Thus, you must all **resolve in mind**,
To **protect the True Dao/Way** faithfully,
Never letting it slip away.

As previously stated,
All these **obstacles** must be **severed and abandoned** by you—
Your **body** will then attain **purity**,
And you will transcend all **difficulties**.
This is called the **Dao-Treasure**,
The **supporting pillar of the Law**.

Furthermore, you must **cultivate and uphold** this **sacred text**,
As if standing before the Emperor himself—
With **reverence and admiration**,
With **devotion to his form**,
With **praise of his name**—
Only then will you behold his **compassionate face**,
All be **protected and guided**,
Universally hear the **mystic teachings**,
And **personally offer reverence and sustenance**,
Never again falling into **worldly cycles**.

At that time, the **Four Assemblies** heard these words and rejoiced,
Exclaiming praise never before encountered.
Here ends the *Chapter of the Sovereign’s Teachings and Severing Obstacles*,
Which has been cross-verified and contains no discrepancies.

The humble servant respectfully states:
A **sutra** is a **path**,
A **method of cultivation**.
When mortals uphold a **sutra**, there are two **gates of practice**:
One is **recitation with the mouth**,
One is **holding in the mind**.

**Recitation with the mouth** refers to **verbal praise**;
**Holding in the mind** refers to **faithful practice through intention**.
**Recitation with the mouth** should take **holding in the mind** as its foundation,
And **holding in the mind** should take **recitation with the mouth** as its priority—
The two **mutually support** each other,
And **merits and virtues** are thus fulfilled.
To **neglect one in favor of the other** is to fail in **merits and virtues**.
Thus, the **sutra** combines both **recitation and holding**.

To **recite without holding** is to **utter empty words**,
While the **mind** remains unbenefited;
To **hold without reciting** is for the **mind** to stir,
Yet the **intent** remains unexpressed.
Both must be **pursued together** for the task to be completed.

As for **reciting and holding** the **Jade Emperor’s sutra**,
You must **follow and emulate** the Emperor’s **merits and virtues**,

1. **Reverence and admiration**,

5. **True Unity and Transformation**.」

chunks.original_text: □『天尊上帝』，白文本作『天尊玉帝』，是。 下同。 □『尽乃』，白文本作『尽承』，是。 □原作『以赞上帝日』。 白文本作『玉帝』； 『赞』 之前有『偈』 字，兹据补。 □『演』，白文本作『放』，是。 卷中　太上大光明圆满大神咒品第二 尔时，天地始祖五老上帝稽首长跪，白天尊言：伏闻高上玉皇一本云天尊高上玉皇。 窃见放光事专属玉皇，今略天尊二字。 慈念苍生，普放神光，照烛法界，六凡四圣，普叨道荫。 窃以凡夫短景，劫运将终，正道宜行，以济兆民，使修真之子有期轻举，末代烝民俱获寿考。 自昔《元始洞玄灵宝赤书玉篇真文》生於元始之先、空洞之中、天地未根，日月未光，幽幽冥冥，无祖无宗，无气无象，无色无名，无形无绪，无音无声，混沌太无，灵文晻暧，乍存乍亡，二仪待之以分，太阳待之以明，灵图革运，玄象推迁，乘机应运，於是存焉。 玉帝授臣灵宝秘篆、大不可思议神咒，故天地得之而分判，三景得之而发光，灵文郁秀，洞映上清，发乎始青之天，而色无定方，支势曲折，不可寻详。 元始炼之於洞阳之馆，冶之於流火之庭，鲜其正文，莹发光芒，洞阳炁赤，故号赤书。 灵图既焕，万帝朝真，飞空步虚，旋行上宫，烧香散花，口咏灵章。 是时天降十二玄瑞，地发二十四应，上庆九天之灵奥，赞三天之宝明。 神风既鼓，皇道咸畅。 元始登命，太真按笔，玉妃拂筵，铸金为简，刻书玉篇，五老掌箓，秘於九天灵都之馆。 玉女典香，太华执巾，玉童侍卫，玉陛朝轩，九天上书，非鬼神所闻。 故天宝之以致浮，地秘之以致安，五帝掌之以得镇，三光乘之以高明，上圣奉之以致神，高尊掌之以致真，五岳从之以得灵，天子得之以致治，国祚享之以太平。 实灵文之妙德，乃天地之玄根。 威灵恢廓，普加无穷，荡荡大化，为神明之宗。 其量莫测，巍巍乎太空，明真有格，今当以行。 是时元始革运，玄象开图，灵文郁秀，神表五方，分判天地，开化万灵。 此大宗之业，可得暂披於灵韫乎？ 今皇道敷畅，泽被十方，仰观劫运，真风宜行。 臣私心实欲使灵荫八遐，风洒兰林，寒条仰希华阳之繁，朽骸蒙受灵奥之津。 仰对元慈，下伸丹恳，惟愿哀悯，抚念苍生，不审《灵宝玉篇真文》可得见授，下教於未闻者乎？ 於是元始天尊抚几高抗，凝真遐想，观时已至，普谓时会一切真圣，论定阴阳，推数劫会，移校河源，检录天度，选择种人，指拈太无，啸朗九玄，永#1无开听於陈辞，有若闭碍求真之路。 是时五老上帝启问不已，良久，元始天尊乃垂盻眦之容，慨尔叹曰：惟乎深哉。 子今所扣，岂不远乎？ 此元始灵宝之玄根，空洞自然之真文，生天立地，开化神明，施镇五岳，安国康民。 灵宝玄妙，为万物之尊，天发玄瑞，灵应自然。 今三天盩运，六天道行，杂法开化，当有三万六千种道以择来者之心。 此法运讫，三龙之后，庚子之年，杂气普消，诸天庆会，吾真道乃行。 今且可相付，当录於上馆，未得行於下世。 玄科有禁，不得便传。

**Chapter Two: The Supreme Great Radiant Perfection Divine Spell of the Great Light**

At that time, the **Primordial Ancestors Five Elders Supreme Emperor** bowed and knelt in reverence, and the **Celestial Sovereign** spoke: *"I have humbly heard that the Most High Jade Sovereign [original: Celestial Sovereign Most High Jade Sovereign] proclaims: 'The affairs of radiant light are uniquely attributed to the Jade Sovereign; now I omit the words 'Celestial Sovereign.' Out of benevolent thought for the common folk, I universally radiate divine light, illuminating the **dharma-realm**, bestowing the **Dao’s shade** upon the six **ordinary beings** and four **sages**. I consider that the ordinary folk have but a fleeting lifespan, the kalpa is nearing its end, the true path must be followed to save the countless people, so that those who cultivate the **True Way** may have hope of rising lightly, and the common folk of this latter age may all attain longevity and prosperity.*

Since antiquity, the ***Primordial Origin Cavern Mystery Divine Treasure Scarlet Scripture Jade Edition True Text*** emerged before the **Primordial Origin**, within the **void**, when heaven and earth had no roots, the sun and moon no light—dim and murky, without ancestor or lineage, without **qi** or form, without color or name, without shape or trace, without sound or voice—utterly chaotic, its **divine script** obscure, sometimes existing, sometimes vanishing. The **Two Principles** awaited it to divide, the **Great Sun** awaited it to illuminate; the **divine diagram** transformed the cosmic order, the **mysterious symbols** shifted with fate. Seizing the **Dao’s opportunity** and responding to the cosmic flow, it thus came into being. The **Jade Emperor** bestowed upon me the **Divine Treasure Secret Seal** and the **Unthinkable Divine Spell**, so that heaven and earth obtained it and were divided, the **Three Lights** obtained it and radiated brilliance. The **divine script** flourished luxuriantly, its mystery reflected in the **Upper Purity**, emanating from the **Primordial Azure Sky**, yet its hue was undetermined, its branches curving and twisting, beyond tracing or scrutiny.

The **Primordial Origin** refined it in the **Cavern Yang** hall and forged it in the **Flowing Fire** court, polishing its true form and radiating its luminous glow—**Cavern Yang’s essence** was crimson, hence its name, the *Scarlet Scripture*. When the **divine diagram** blazed forth, the **Ten Thousand Emperors** paid homage to the **True One**, flying through the void and walking on empty air, circling the **Upper Palace**, burning incense and scattering flowers, chanting the **Divine Verses** with their mouths. At that time, heaven sent down **Twelve Mysterious Auspices**, earth emitted **Twenty-Four Responses**, the **Upper Palace** celebrated the **Nine Heavens’ Cavern Depths**, and praised the **Three Heavens’ Precious Clarity**. The **divine wind** having stirred, the **Imperial Dao** was universally spread.

The **Primordial Origin** ascended to decree, the **Great True One** pressed the brush, the **Jade Consort** swept the mat, casting **golden tablets** and carving the *Scarlet Scripture Jade Edition*. The **Five Elders** held the **sacred talisman**, concealing it in the **Nine Heavens’ Cavern Depths**. The **Jade Maiden** attended to the incense, **Great Hua** held the cloth, the **Jade Boys** served as guards, and the **Jade Platform** faced the **Upper Courtyard**, where the **Nine Heavens’ Sacred Edict** was inscribed—unheard by ghosts or gods. Thus, heaven treasured it to bring about **floating prosperity**, earth concealed it to bring about **tranquility**, the **Five Emperors** wielded it to achieve **stabilization**, the **Three Lights** rode upon it to attain **high clarity**, the **Upper Sages** revered it to reach **divinity**, the **High Exalted** held it to attain **True Perfection**, the **Five Sacred Peaks** followed it to gain **spiritual resonance**, the **Son of Heaven** obtained it to bring about **governance**, and the **national lineage** enjoyed it for **great peace**.

It is indeed the **mysterious virtue** of the **divine script**, the **primordial root** of heaven and earth. Its **might and spirit** are vast and boundless, its **great transformation** sweeping and eternal, serving as the **foundation of the divine**. Its measure is unfathomable, towering in the **Great Void**. Its **true clarity** is fixed; now it is time to put it into practice.

At that time, the **Primordial Origin** transformed the cosmic order, the **mysterious symbols** opened the diagram, the **divine script** flourished luxuriantly, the **spiritual essence** spread across the **Five Directions**, dividing heaven and earth, enlightening all beings. This is the **great foundation’s work**; can it be briefly revealed in the **Divine Treasure Repository**?

Now, the **Imperial Dao** is universally spread, its blessings reaching the **Ten Directions**. Gazing upward at the **kalpa’s end**, the **true wind** must be followed. My sincere wish is to spread the **Dao’s shade** to the **eight far reaches**, let the **true wind** scatter across the **orchid groves**, so that even withering branches may aspire to the **Primordial Yang’s abundance**, and decayed bones may receive the **Cavern Depths’ sacred blessings**.

I humbly address the **Primordial Benevolence**, extending my **sincere supplication** below. Only by your pity and compassion may I hope to obtain the **Divine Treasure True Text’s transmission**, and teach those who have not yet heard?

Thus, the **Primordial Origin Celestial Sovereign** patted the table and raised his voice, concentrating his **True Essence** in deep contemplation. Observing that the time had arrived, he declared to all the **True Saints** of the **cosmic assembly**: *"The principles of yin and yang are now determined, the **kalpa’s numbers** are calculated, the **River Source’s movements** are observed, the **heavenly degrees** are recorded, the **seed-people** are selected, and the **Great Void** is pointed out. The **Nine Mysteries** resound, and yet the **Three Millennia** remain unopened to common speech—it is as though a barrier obstructs the path to the **True**. At that time, the **Five Elders Supreme Emperor** repeatedly questioned, and after a long while, the **Primordial Origin Celestial Sovereign** lowered his gaze and sighed deeply: 'Alas! How profound it is! The matters you now inquire—are they not distant?

This is the **Primordial Origin’s Divine Treasure**, the **true text of void and naturalness**. It gives rise to heaven and earth, enlightens the **divine**, stabilizes the **Five Sacred Peaks**, and brings peace to the people. The **Divine Treasure** is profoundly mysterious, the **Most Exalted** of all things. Heaven sends forth **mysterious auspices**, and the **spiritual** responds naturally.

Now, the **Three Heavens** are in **harmonious motion**, the **Six Heavens** follow the **Dao’s course**, and the **heterodox teachings** are opening their transformations. There will be **thirty-six thousand kinds of Dao** to choose from for those who seek the **True Way**. When this **Dao’s course** concludes, after the **Three Dragons**, in the year **Gengzi**, all **impure qi** will dissipate, and the **heavens will celebrate in assembly**. Then my **True Dao** will be followed.

For now, you may entrust it to me, and it shall be recorded in the **Upper Palace**. It has not yet been revealed in the **lower world**. The **mysterious teachings** have restrictions; they cannot be casually transmitted."*

chunks.original_text: 臣谨言曰：五老上帝分理五天，下地万生俱属统治，妙道生成之任，莫此为尊。 故玉帝初劫，升以度人，弥灾制魔，《玉篇真文》畀之，以接度学仙之人，畀之禳救星辰之灾，又畀之息洪流，制魔害，无非所以厚生成之泽，使万类各得其所也。 五老既奉之，以守其职矣。 犹恐帝恩之未博，生灵之未遂，故於玉帝放光之后，继用启陈，挈所受之真文，以授下世。 吁，帝心之慈，如此其至也。 而五老能广而充之，岂非上圣之心均於仁爱也欤。 前《五篇真文》，道书备载，书篆之式，施行之诀，悉详见於诸经。 今兹载於《本行经》者，特正文也。 盖《本行经》专主於诵念，故正文不可无，而云篆庸可略？ 至若一切诸符、九炁诸炁真文、三元诸符，今并略之，刊於经末。 修行者各当即行之，但真篆正文之诵，尤当严谨。 盖此文乃上帝诰命也。 诰命之宣，万灵闻之，莫不稽首。 傥轻慢苟简，视为常文，出入吻唇，姑为谈戏，则惩责之酷，当如《报应品》中之载。 诵经者，宜钦奉之。 臣良谨言。 道言：是大神咒者，元始之妙言，玉皇之真诰，上清自然之灵书，九天始生之玄札，空洞之灵章，上圣之秘语，玉晨之尊典； 成天立地，开张万真，安神镇灵，生成兆民，匡御运度，保天长存； 上制天机，中检五灵，下策地祇，啸命河源，运役阴阳，召神使仙。 此至真之妙文，神应自然，致天高澄，令地固安，保镇五岳，万品存焉。 玉帝昔授五老上帝。 是时五帝跪捧其章，秘题灵都之馆，天真皇人昔书其文，掌之於上清真境太玄玉都寒灵丹殿紫微上宫，累经劫运，而其文保固天根，无有毁沦，与运推迁。 是大神咒混之不浊，秽之愈清，毁之不灭，灭之极明。 大有之文，天真所尊，自光#3真名，帝图刻简，昭示#4来生，斯文隐秘，不得窥闻。 有得之子，保万气长存。 勤行修奉，克#5致神仙。 臣谨言曰：《五篇玉书真文》神功妙用，莫可测量，盖得度人录仙真文而施行之，则九天众真纪名仙籍，降炁接度； 得制星真文而施行之，则三光照形，列曜削厄，形神炁命，不罹殒伤； 得制魔真文而施行之，则北酆畏威，万魔束首，百邪敬栗，弗敢侵馘； 得制水真文而施行之，则万龙保身，水府钦畏，劫坏之日，可跨蛟虬而越九霄。 吁，神功妙用，果可度量哉。 但施行之诀，别有秘要，非世人皆可获此效也。 惟学仙之士，当仿其诀而服行之。 故经曰：有得之子，保万炁长存，勤行修奉，克致神仙。 臣既职校经，不敢不举其要，以告来者。 伏乞上圣垂鉴。 臣良谨言。

The humble subject respectfully declares:

The Five Elders of the Celestial Sovereign govern the Five Heavens, and all life upon the earth falls under their dominion. None surpass their exalted role in nurturing the Mystic Dao’s creation. Therefore, when the Jade Sovereign first ascended in the Great Calamity, He bestowed the *Way* to save humanity, to curb disasters and subdue demons. The *True Scriptures of the Jade Canon* were entrusted to them, to guide those seeking Daoist cultivation, to avert celestial calamities, to still the great floods, and to restrain demonic harm—all for the sake of enriching the blessings of creation, ensuring all beings find their rightful place. The Five Elders, having received this mandate, now uphold their sacred duty.

Yet fearing the Emperor’s grace might not yet be fully extended or that living beings might still suffer, after the Jade Sovereign’s radiant manifestation, they further proclaimed and transmitted the *True Scriptures* they had received, passing them down to future generations. Ah! The Emperor’s compassion is so profound! And the Five Elders, in broadening and fulfilling this mission, are they not embodying the benevolent hearts of the Highest Saints?

The *Five-Part True Scriptures* are fully recorded in Daoist texts, with their seals and methods of invocation detailed in the various scriptures. What is now inscribed in the *Scripture of Original Practice* is but the core text. Since the *Scripture of Original Practice* centers on recitation, the core text must be preserved, though the seals and auxiliary methods may be omitted. As for all talismans, the Five-Qi *True Scriptures of the Five-Qi*, and the Three-Epoch talismans, these are likewise omitted here and recorded at the end of the scripture. Practitioners must apply them accordingly, but above all, the recitation of the true seals and core text must be performed with utmost reverence. For this text is the Jade Sovereign’s decree. When the decree is proclaimed, all spirits hear it and bow in submission. Should one treat it with negligence, reciting it carelessly as mere common scripture, uttering it lightly with lips and tongue as idle chatter, then the punishments shall be severe—just as recorded in the *Chapter on Retribution and Response*. Those who recite the scripture must venerate it with solemn devotion. The humble subject respectfully declares this.

The Dao proclaims: This is the Great Divine Spell—the Primordial’s wondrous speech, the Jade Sovereign’s true decree, the Upper Clarity’s natural sacred text, the Primordial Five-Heavens’ mystic tablet, the void’s luminous chapter, the Highest Saints’ secret utterance, the Celestial Dawn’s exalted canon. It establishes Heaven and Earth, unfurls myriad truths, calms the spirit and subdues the numinous, nurtures and sustains the myriad peoples, rectifies and governs the cosmic order, and preserves eternal Heaven. It governs celestial mechanisms above, inspects the Five Spirits in the middle, strategizes earthly deities below, commands the Yellow River’s source, directs the forces of yin and yang, and summons gods while dispatching immortals. This is the ultimate true text—its divine efficacy is spontaneous. It clarifies the heavens, stabilizes the earth, and safeguards the Five Sacred Peaks, ensuring all things endure. The Jade Sovereign once bestowed it upon the Five Elders of the Celestial Sovereign. At that time, the Five Emperors knelt, reverently receiving the tablet, and secretly inscribed it in the Hall of the Spirit Capital. The Primordial True Man formerly recorded this text and entrusted it to the Upper Clarity’s True Realm, the Supreme Mystic Jade Capital, the Cold Spirit Hall of the Purple Micro, enduring through countless kalpas, its essence preserved at the Heavenly Root, uncorrupted and unlost, shifting with the cosmic cycles. This Great Divine Spell is undefiled by mixture, its purity only deepened by defilement; it cannot be destroyed by ruin, for ruin only reveals its brilliance. It is the Great One’s text, revered by the Primordial True—from the Radiant #3 True Name, inscribed on imperial tablets, revealed to future generations. This sacred text is hidden and secret, not to be glimpsed or heard by any. Those who attain it shall preserve the eternal *qi* and, through diligent practice, attain divinity.

The humble subject respectfully declares: The *Five-Part Jade Book True Scriptures* possess divine functions beyond measure. If one obtains the *Scriptures for Guiding and Recording Immortals* and applies them, then the Nine-Heavens’ assembled immortals shall be recorded in the celestial registers, and their *qi* shall be transmitted to guide them. If one obtains the *Scriptures for Governing Stars* and applies them, then the sun, moon, and stars shall shine upon one’s form, the constellations shall ward off misfortune, and life, spirit, *qi*, and fate shall suffer no destruction. If one obtains the *Scriptures for Subduing Demons* and applies them, then the Northern Underworld shall fear its might, ten thousand demons shall be bound, and a hundred evils shall tremble in reverence, daring not to encroach. If one obtains the *Scriptures for Governing Water* and applies them, then the ten thousand dragons shall protect their forms, the Water Palaces shall revere in awe, and on the day of cosmic destruction, one may ride the great serpents and ascend the Nine Heavens. Ah! The divine functions and marvelous efficacy—can they truly be measured?

Yet the methods of application hold secret keys, not all of which common folk may attain. Only those who seek the Dao must emulate these methods and practice them diligently. Thus the scripture says: *"Those who attain it shall preserve the eternal qi and, through diligent practice, attain divinity."* The humble subject, having verified the scripture, dares not omit its essentials and thus informs those who come after. May the Highest Saints look upon this with favor. The humble subject, Liang, respectfully declares.

chunks.original_text: #1 『永』，白文本作『念』。 #2 『听』，原作『视』。 兹据白文本改。 #3 『光』，原作『无』。 兹据白文本改。 #4原脱『昭示』二字。 兹据白文本补。 #5 『克』原作『刻』。 兹据白文本改。 （下同）。 卷中　洞玄灵宝玉皇功德品第三 尔时玉虚上帝白天尊言：唯愿慈悲，愿为四众、帝释等及四梵天王、一切诸天、一切诸仙及未来一切众生持是经人说利益事。 尔时天尊告玉虚上帝言：快哉斯问，不亦善乎。 汝以慈悲，愍念众生，故请问於我。 天尊言曰：若有三界十方无量国土、及国王大臣，或兵戈并起，疫气大行，水早虫蝗，凶灾饥馑，是其国君、后妃、太子、宰辅、大臣，当发慈悲，为其黎庶徧敕国内州县镇宰，令诸道流清净严洁，于其观内设大斋醮，六时行道，为转此经。 当得国土清平，五谷丰熟，黎庶安泰。 臣谨言曰：世有言曰，干羽不足以释围，乡饮不足以息战。 此事理之当然者也。 夫剽悍祸贼，始从事於干戈，寇贼奸宄，始容心於兵革，非智术有以过之，勇力有以胜之，决未可以挫其威虐也。 乃今《玉帝经》中谓，干戈并起之难，当敕国内臣庶，命道流诵真经以息之，何其迂诞也哉。 吁，是大不然也。 夫天变上临，则地祸下作，干戈兵革，莫非自夫阴阳拂逆，缠度汨乱，乃始流灾而起乱。 今观往昔之图识，则可验也。 是以经中之训，俾国家值乱，则以斯而禳援，盖所以请命上天，消天变而息地祸，非谓以斯经而止乱也。 若夫厉兵秣马，高城深池，宁可一日废哉？ 昔有庸君，识见窒昧，乃直谓释老经咒可以御敌，旋罹祸难，至贻哂诮，迄今为羞，良可叹也。 今世昧夫，凡暏是经，率执此为谤毁之自，敢因校经而辩之。 臣良谨言。 若复有人，入诸山林，遇毒恶兽，但能存想，一念真经，山神卫护，猛兽自退，终不害己。 若入江入海，采宝求珍，值遇恶风，如法持念是此真经，风浪顿止，安稳达岸。 若在军阵，戈戟既接，两刃相交，存心默念是此真经，是诸恶贼，悉自退散。 若在牢狱，枷锁之中，净心定虑，存念真经，冤枉自伸，即得解脱。 若为邪精鬼贼众苦所加，如法持念是此真经，众邪远避，自然除愈。 若人为求嗣息，如法尊重，持念此经，帝敕天曹明检丹籍，九品之内，四果仙人，运应数合，降谪下生，为其作子，才辩明慧，人中尊贵。 若妇人临难之月，如法持念是此真经，即得母子平安，生福德男女，人所爱敬。 若为求官进职，爵录亨达，贵遇人君，如法持念是此真经，即得职务迁转，子孙荣遇，世世不绝。 若人欲求资财殷富，如法奉持是此真经，即得财宝充溢，衣食自然，庆流子孙，传之万世。 若人被诸恶星之所照临，困苦肺枕，如法持念是此真经，是诸恶星，返降吉祥。 若人命过，应入地狱，注名恶籍，父母师长、夫妻男女，当为亡人持念真经，或安置道场，旛花供养，即得亡者鬼籍尽除，神生净土； 同苦罪众，咸蒙护度，承斯胜利，皆生天上。 又此经所在之处，常有十天至真大圣无极飞天神王侍卫供养，持是经人，当得自称为正一真人。 是人在处，自得十方至真至圣金刚力士潜护其人，如护己身，若出若入，游行之处，百邪避路，魔鬼殄除，精灵伏藏，一切灾殃，不能侵近。

At that time, the Jade Void Emperor spoke to the Celestial Worthy: *"May Your Compassion endure. May You benefit the Four Assemblies, the *Devā* (天尊), the Four Heavenly Kings, all the celestial beings, all the immortals, and all future beings who uphold and proclaim this scripture."*

The Celestial Worthy then said to the Jade Void Emperor: *"How splendid this question! Is it not excellent?"*
*"You, moved by compassion and pity for all beings, thus inquire of me."*

The Celestial Worthy said: *"Should any in the Three Realms and the Ten Directions—whether a kingdom’s ruler, great ministers, or common folk—face war’s outbreak, rampant pestilence, drought, flood, locusts, or famine, then the sovereign, the queen, the crown prince, the prime ministers, and the great ministers must awaken their compassion. They shall universally command the officials of their domains and prefectures to purify and sanctify the Daoist adepts (*dàoliú*). Within their temples, they shall establish grand fasting and exorcistic rites (*zhāijiào*), practicing the Dao at all six times of day, to circulate this scripture. Thus, the land shall know peace, the five grains shall flourish, and the people shall prosper in security."*

The humble subject respectfully declares: *"There is a saying in the world: ‘Sacrificial feathers cannot dispel a siege, and a village feast cannot halt a war.’ This is the natural order of affairs. Bold bandits first take up arms, and robbers and traitors first harbor treacherous intentions. Unless wisdom and strategy surpass them, or valor and strength overcome them, their tyranny shall never be thwarted.*

Alas, this is far from correct. When celestial omens manifest above, terrestrial calamities arise below; war and strife stem from the discord of yin and yang, the entanglement of fate and chaos, and only then do disasters spread and chaos erupt. Examining past records confirms this truth.*

As for arming soldiers, fortifying walls, and deepening moats, can these ever be abandoned for a single day?*

chunks.original_text: 是持经人命欲终时，更不见诸地狱恶相，即见天宫一切玉女持幢下迎，而生天上； 如天福尽，下降人间，即得千生万生中常为帝王#6 ，令国土清平，人民乐业，兼得为王，获宿性通#7 ，遵奉大道，展转修持，至登道岸。 是持经人获福如是。 又若有持是经人，若雨下时起大悲心，如法吕向空念此经三卷一徧，其雨所沾，面所向方一切众生，五逆十恶、一切重罪，悉皆消灭，一切重病，便得痊愈。 是诸众生，命终之后，不堕地狱，神生净土，莲花化生，何况持是经者。 又若有持是经人，若行於道路，值大风起吹，是持经之人触身之尘，是尘所沾，一切众生一切恶业，悉皆灭尽，更不堕三恶道，当生天上。 故知持经功德，不可思议。 是持经人若在江、在河、在海，沐浴其身，是水所沾，其中众生、鱼鳖鼋鼉、一切水族，是诸众罪，悉得除灭。 尽此一报之身，命过之后，更不受胎卵湿化一切等身。 是持经人，口出一切语言，或善或恶，一切天魔外道闻者，皆是清净法音。 是持经人，若遇诸神庙，能为其神诵咏是经，是诸鬼神得闻是经，即脱鬼趣，登真仙道，恭敬是人，如奉是帝。 若人在世，不孝父母，不敬三宝，杀生偷盗，邪淫妄语，作种种极重罪业，将命终时，若有道心正信众生，于是亡者未气断时，起大悲心，于其头边念帝尊号，或一七、二七、三七、四七，乃至百徧、千徧，是其亡者生前所造诸不善业，悉得消灭，更不堕诸恶趣，神升九天，何况受持是此经者。 又若复有人，自从往劫，乃至今身，轮转人天，漂沈世域，积千愆万过，在於己身，若遇是持经人影暂映其身，如为帝光之所摄受，或与同语，或闻其声，如奉帝言道语慰谕，彼人罪障，永得除灭。 又若持是经人，造作长旛，书帝名号于其旛上，悬诸长竿，或是观宇，或在家庭，是旛被诸风吹，所指方面，一切众生皆沾胜利，一切恶业悉得除灭。 又若有持是经人书帝名号在一切有声物上，或钟或磬，铃铎铙钹，一切道具，法事之属，或以道场，或以戏击，或被风触，是声出时，或远或近，一切众生，闻是声已，所有罪障，悉得清净。 又若有持是经人，了悟生死，深入山林，修真学道，或时登临，上山顾望，目所及处，山林溪谷，含生品类，有形无形，胎卵湿化，动植飞潜，种种诸类，所有罪业，永得除灭，身心清净，命终生天，何况受持是此经者。 当知是人即是道藏功德身也。 臣谨言曰：天尊之语，实而不虚，真而不妄。 其片辞只字，曷尝若发，凡世昧者识未通真，见不诣远，或於诸经苟有少可议，则遂从而疑之，以为世无是理也。 呜呼，是人也，奚不详观熟究，耽研咀味，而曲求其旨哉？ 《功德品》中天尊说持经之人所得功德，如所谓死而生天，天福之尽，当得千生万生中可为帝王，与夫持经之人诵经於雨下之时，涉途於风起之际，至於沐於水，观於山，现於影，能畀一切众生罪恶消除，获大功德，以为无有是理。 彼盖谓帝王之福，高而无踰，非诵经之功可得而获证也。 况千生万生常为帝王乎？ 彼又谓诵经之福及一身可也，众生极重过恶、四生积愆受报，此天宪之确，纤毫不移，使经百劫而不亡，果报犹当自受，焉可以诵经之身，一历其所而顿能解脱，且获福德也哉？
chunks.translated_text:
「When the life of one who upholds this scripture draws to its end, they shall not witness the dreadful forms of the underworlds, but instead shall see all the celestial palaces filled with jade maidens bearing banners to welcome them, ascending to the heavens.

Should their celestial blessings be exhausted and they descend into the mortal realm, they shall perpetually be reborn as emperors and kings throughout countless lifetimes, ensuring the land remains serene and the people prosper in their livelihoods. Moreover, they shall attain the nature of their former lives, follow the Dao/Way, and through successive cultivation, ultimately reach the shore of transcendence.

Such are the blessings bestowed upon those who uphold this scripture.

Furthermore, if one who upholds this scripture, when rain falls, awakens a great compassion and, as prescribed, recites this scripture three times in the direction of the sky, all beings touched by the rain or within the direction they face—those who have committed the Five Treasons and Ten Evils, or any grave offenses—shall have their sins utterly eradicated, and all severe illnesses shall be instantly cured.

These beings, upon death, shall not fall into the underworlds but be reborn in Pure Lands, emerging from lotus flowers. How much more so shall those who uphold this scripture themselves!

Again, if one who upholds this scripture walks along a path when a great wind arises and blows, the dust that touches their body shall, upon contact, cause all beings in the direction it settles to have their evil deeds entirely extinguished. They shall not be reborn in the Three Evil Paths but ascend to the heavens.

Thus, the virtues of upholding this scripture are beyond reckoning.

If one who upholds this scripture bathes in rivers, lakes, or seas, the water touching their body shall purify all beings within it—fish, turtles, crocodiles, and all aquatic creatures—clearing away their sins. After this single lifetime, upon their death, they shall no longer be reborn in any form, whether as an embryo, egg, or wet-born being.

The words spoken by one who upholds this scripture, whether good or evil, shall all be heard by celestial and demonic forces, the Ten Directions, and external Dao/Way sects, as pure and sacred teachings.

If one who upholds this scripture encounters any shrine of the gods, they may recite this scripture for its deity. All spirits and gods who hear it shall escape their ghostly fate, ascend to the path of true immortals, and revere this person as they would an emperor.

Should a person in this world fail to honor their parents, disrespect the Three Jewels, engage in killing, theft, licentiousness, or false speech, and commit countless grave offenses, and upon nearing death, if there are any with a Dao/Way-heart and true faith in all beings, they may, during the dying person’s last breaths, awaken great compassion and invoke the name of the Emperor at their head—whether seven times, fourteen times, twenty-one times, twenty-eight times, up to a hundred or a thousand recitations—thus all the unvirtuous deeds committed in their lifetime shall be utterly eradicated. They shall not fall into any evil realm, and their spirit shall ascend to the Nine Heavens. How much more so shall those who uphold and receive this scripture!

Again, if one has, from past kalpas until this very life, cycled through human and heavenly realms, drifted across all worlds, accumulating myriad sins and transgressions, and if they merely encounter the shadow of one who upholds this scripture cast upon their body—or are illuminated by the Emperor’s light—or hear their words, or even converse with them—as though receiving the Emperor’s spoken teachings and consolation—then their sins and obstacles shall be permanently removed.

If one who upholds this scripture crafts a long banner and inscribes the Emperor’s name upon it, raising it on tall poles, whether in temples or households, and the wind blows it, pointing in any direction, all beings in that path shall attain supreme victory, and their evil deeds shall be utterly eradicated.

If one who upholds this scripture writes the Emperor’s name upon any resonant object—whether bells, chimes, gongs, or drums—all ritual implements and Dao/Way instruments, whether used in a Dao/Way hall, struck in a ceremony, or touched by the wind, their sound, near or far, shall cause all beings who hear it to have their sins and obstacles completely purified.

If one who upholds this scripture, having penetrated the mysteries of birth and death, retreats into the mountains and forests to cultivate true virtue and learn the Dao/Way, and at times ascends to gaze upon the world, wherever their eyes reach—across mountains, forests, streams, and valleys—all living beings, whether formed or formless, born from eggs, wombs, or moisture, and all mobile or rooted creatures, shall have their sins permanently removed. Their body and mind shall be cleansed, and upon death, they shall be reborn in the heavens. How much more so shall those who uphold and receive this scripture!

Know that such a person is indeed the embodiment of the Dao/Way’s treasury of virtues.

Your humble servant respectfully states: The words of the Heavenly Sage are true and not false, genuine and not fraudulent.

Yet, those who are ignorant in this world and lack true understanding, seeing only superficial interpretations, may even doubt minor passages in other scriptures, assuming no such principles exist in the world. Alas! Why do they not carefully examine and deeply investigate, pondering and savoring the meaning, rather than seeking it in convoluted ways?

In the *Function and Virtue Chapter*, the Heavenly Sage speaks of the blessings attained by those who uphold the scripture—such as dying and ascending to the heavens, or being reborn as emperors and kings across countless lifetimes. He also describes how, when reciting the scripture during rain, walking paths during windstorms, bathing in water, gazing upon mountains, or casting shadows, they can bestow upon all beings the eradication of their sins and the attainment of great virtues—yet some claim no such principles exist.

They say that the blessings of emperors and kings are too lofty to be surpassed, and that the virtues of reciting scriptures cannot truly be attained or verified.

Much less could one perpetually be reborn as an emperor or king across countless lifetimes!

They further claim that the blessings of reciting scriptures may apply to oneself, but not to beings burdened with grave sins and transgressions, who suffer retribution across four lives. This is the unalterable decree of the heavens, not a single hair’s breadth can be changed. Even if the scripture endures for a hundred kalpas without perishing, the fruit of karma must still be borne by oneself. How could the body of one who recites the scripture, in a single passing, instantly liberate them and grant such blessings?»

Such individuals, wherever they go, shall be invisibly guarded by the *Jīnjiāng Lìshì* (Golden-Armored Vajra Warriors) from the Ten Directions—protecting them as their own body. Whether entering or exiting, in all their movements, malevolent forces shall avoid their path, demons shall be exterminated, spirits shall cower, and all calamities shall be powerless to approach.**
