chunks.original_text: 斯人之语，盖知其一而未知其二也。 且夫行尧之行，即尧之身，希颜之人，亦颜之徒。 今有人焉於是经也，朝於斯，夕於斯，趋亦趋，步亦步，於《本行经》中诵其言，行其事，咀其华，含其英，仿十大妙行而服行之，敬断障诸戒而离远之，守之以坚，持之以诚，愈久而不渝，受挠而不变，日渐月渍，混然与玉帝之身如出於一，或陟或降，在帝左右，则彼身乃帝身也，帝身亦彼身也。 身既混融，则功德之成，岂有异哉？ 玉帝放光，神化若是之广且大，则今兹诵经之人，所历所至，其福荫众生，亦犹帝恩、帝光之所暨及也。 虽然，斯言也，天尊谓诵持斯经而纯与帝合者矣，非谓入耳出口徒曰诵念者言也，然而自入耳出口，诵念不替，充而至於与帝之合，则正一真人之自称，殆亦未可以表其德操也。 学士宜思而行之。 臣良谨言。 尔时天尊谓玉虚上帝言：今我略说，未尽其妙，若广说之，凡流邪见，疑惑不信。 是经功德，穷劫难言。 尔时玉虚上帝闻是说已，心生欢喜，不胜踊跃，瞻仰慈颜，稽首而作颂曰： 九天之上，谓之大罗。 玉京金阙，云层峨峨。 中有天帝，仁慈惠和。 至道无敌，降伏众魔。 天宝灵符，玉律金科。 神仙亿万，幢旛众多。 闻者罪灭，永出爱河。 是号玉皇，穹苍真老，妙圆清净，智慧辩才，至道至尊，三界师，混元祖，无能胜主，四生慈父，高天上圣，大慈仁者。 十号圆满，万德周身，无量度人，拔生死苦。 尔时玉虚上帝说是颂及十号已，是诸天众异口同音，叹未曾有。 臣谨言曰：事悦於心，辞溢於外。 故玉虚上帝之赞，推尊称颂，极言苦谈，求有以尽玉帝之德。 吁，帝德之大，其可言尽哉。 臣敢以不言为称赞，庶与玉虚上帝相表里云。 臣良谨言。 高上玉皇本行集经卷中 #6『帝王』，白文本作『国王』。 #7『兼得为王获宿性通』，白文本作『常得宿性通明』。 卷下　天真护持品第四 尔时昊天上帝闻说经法，从座而起，长跪帝前，白言玉#1帝，愿为大众及诸人天持是经人说利益事。 尔时玉皇尊帝兴方便意，开利益门，宣玉匮科，传灵宝法，告於昊天上帝言：汝今谛听，当为汝说受持功德，扶危拔苦，利益存亡、神妙之事。 众真稽首，俱发声言：弟子臣等，今日幸闻湛然常住之法，莫不上福三界诸天，下消三涂毒害。 惟愿慈悲，愍臣等故，演斯妙义。 玉帝告曰：若有众生，孝养父母，恭敬三宝，竭忠於君，不杀不盗，不淫不妬，不嗔不恨，不骄不诈，奉戒持斋，冥心大道，生尊重心，诵持是经，我即敕下周流沙界，徧传十方无极世界。 敕命东方东华帝君青骑、神仙兵马、无鞅数众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 敕命东南搏桑大帝与其部众、神仙兵马、无鞅数众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 敕命南方朱陵大帝赤骑、神仙兵马、无鞅数众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 敕命西南太华元老与其部众、神仙兵马、无鞅数众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 敕命西方皓灵黄老白骑、神仙兵马、无鞅数众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 敕命西北皇天上帝与其部众、神仙兵马、无鞅数众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 敕命北方紫微帝君黑骑、神仙兵马、无鞅数众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。
chunks.translated_text:
This speaker’s words reveal only half the truth, not the whole.

Indeed, to walk the Dao of Yao is to embody Yao’s own self—
to emulate Yan’s conduct is to follow in Yan’s footsteps.
Yet now there are those who, with this scripture,
morning and evening recite its words,
hurry and step in accordance with its precepts,
delve into the *Benxing Jing* and practice its teachings,
chew its essence and savor its spirit,
imitating the Ten Marvelous Practices and upholding them in action,
observing all prohibitions with strict devotion and keeping far from them,
guarding it with firm resolve and holding it with unwavering sincerity,
evermore enduring without wavering, even when obstructed,
day by day, month by month,
until their form blends seamlessly with that of the Jade Sovereign,
ascending or descending at His side—
then that body is the Sovereign’s body,
and the Sovereign’s body is that of the practitioner.

Once their forms merge,
the virtues and powers that arise—
how could they differ?

When the Jade Sovereign emits His radiance,
His divine transformations are so vast and grand—
then those who recite this scripture,
wherever they go and whatever they do,
shall bestow blessings upon all beings,
just as the Sovereign’s grace and light pervade all.

Yet these words,
spoken by the Celestial Lord,
refer to those who recite and uphold this scripture
with purity, uniting wholly with the Sovereign—
not to those who merely chant it aloud,
mouthing words without true devotion.
Still, even if one begins with mere chanting,
unceasing in recitation until their essence merges with the Sovereign’s,
then their claim as a True Person of the One Dao
hardly does justice to their virtue and conduct.

Scholars should ponder these words and act accordingly.
Your humble servant, Liang, speaks thus.

At that time, the Celestial Lord addressed the Jade Emperor of the Upper Pure Realm:
*"I have spoken briefly,
yet not exhausted its profundity.
If I were to expound fully,
all who hold heretical views
would only grow more doubtful and unbelieving.
The virtues of this scripture
are boundless—even kalpas cannot encompass them."*

When the Jade Emperor of the Upper Pure Realm heard these words,
His heart filled with joy,
unable to contain His exultation.
Gazing upon the Lord’s benevolent countenance,
He bowed in reverence and composed a hymn:

Above the Nine Heavens,
lies the Great Luo.
Jade Capital, golden gates,
clouds piled high and majestic.
Within resides the Celestial Sovereign,
kind and benevolent, compassionate and harmonious.
His Dao is peerless,
subduing all demons.
The Heavenly Treasure is His sacred talisman,
Jade precepts and golden laws.
Countless immortals and deities,
their banners and flags in abundance.
Those who hear this scripture
shall have their sins erased,
forever freed from the River of Suffering.
This is the Jade Sovereign,
the True Venerable of the Vaulted Sky,
the Perfect Circle of Purity,
possessing wisdom and eloquence,
the Dao most exalted,
the Teacher of the Three Realms,
the Ancestor of the Mixed Element,
unmatched in dominion,
the Merciful Father of the Four Generations,
the Most Holy of the Highest Heavens,
the Great Compassionate and Benevolent One.
Ten names complete,
ten thousand virtues embodied,
limitless in liberating beings,
extracting them from the苦 of birth and death.

When the Jade Emperor of the Upper Pure Realm spoke this hymn and its ten names,
all the celestial hosts in unison
exclaimed in wonderment at what they had never before heard.

Your humble servant, Liang, speaks thus:
*"When the heart takes delight,
the words overflow beyond measure.
Thus, the Jade Emperor’s praise
exalts and extols,
speaking of virtues with utmost fervor,
seeking to fully express the Sovereign’s power.
Ah! The Sovereign’s virtue is so vast—
how could it ever be fully spoken?
Your servant dares to say that silence itself is the highest praise,
truly reflecting the Sovereign’s glory as the Upper Pure Lord does."*

Your humble servant, Liang, speaks thus.

From the *Highest Jade Sovereign’s Original Practices Scripture*, Volume #6 *"The Emperor"*,
the original text reads *"The King"*.
The seventh passage, *"compatible with the Emperor’s nature and attain enlightenment"*,
the original text reads *"constantly attain enlightenment of the nature"*.

Volume Two, *The Chapter on the Celestial True Ones’ Protection*
At that time, the Emperor of the Vaulted Sky, upon hearing the scripture’s teachings,
rose from His seat and knelt long before the Sovereign,
addressing the Jade Emperor:
*"Your servant, the Emperor of the Vaulted Sky,
prays that You may hold this scripture
and proclaim its benefits to all beings and celestial hosts.
May You protect those who uphold this scripture."*

Then the Jade Sovereign, moved by compassion,
opened the gate of blessings,
proclaimed the *Yugai Ke* (Jade Treasury Scripture),
and transmitted the *Lingbao Fa* (Sacred Treasure Teachings),
telling the Emperor of the Vaulted Sky:
*"Now listen carefully,
for I shall speak of the virtues of upholding this scripture—
its power to rescue the perilous, extract the suffering,
benefit the living and the dead,
and reveal its divine and mysterious truths."*

The Celestial True Ones bowed in reverence,
all speaking in unison:
*"Your disciples and humble servants
today have the fortune to hear this eternal, unchanging law.
May it bring blessings to all three realms and heavens above,
and below, may it dispel the poisons of the Three Lower Paths.
With Your boundless compassion,
pitying our lowly state,
please expound this profound meaning."*

The Jade Sovereign replied:
*"If any being
honors their parents with filial devotion,
respects the Three Treasures with reverence,
lends their utmost loyalty to their ruler,
commits neither murder nor theft,
neither lewdness nor jealousy,
neither anger nor grudges,
neither arrogance nor deceit,
and upholds the precepts while keeping fasts,
devoting their hearts to the Great Dao,
nurturing a mind of reverence,
and reciting this scripture,
I shall decree that it be spread throughout the Jambudvīpa (continent of the east),
transmitted to all ten directions of the boundless world.
I command the Eastern Hua Emperor,
with His green cavalry, immortal troops, and countless legions,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.
I command the Great Boshan Emperor of the Southeast,
with His divine hosts, immortal troops, and countless legions,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.
I command the Great Zhuling Emperor of the South,
with His red cavalry, immortal troops, and countless legions,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.
I command the Elder Taihua of the Southwest,
with His divine hosts, immortal troops, and countless legions,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.
I command the Yellow Old Master of the Western Hua,
with His white cavalry, immortal troops, and countless legions,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.
I command the Jade Sovereign of the Northwest,
with His divine hosts, immortal troops, and countless legions,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.
I command the Purple Micro Emperor of the North,
with His black cavalry, immortal troops, and countless legions,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture."*

chunks.original_text: 敕命东北冲虚天君与其部众、神仙兵马、无鞅数众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 敕命中央天皇大帝昆仑苍老黄骑、神仙兵马、无鞅数众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 敕命上方来和天君、名山大洞神仙兵马、无鞅数众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 敕命下方一切金仙、四众八部、及诸眷属，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 救命十方飞天神王、飞天大神、三官四圣、曜九星、北斗南斗、东斗西斗、中斗、二十八宿、周天众星、金刚力士、神王等众，各与部众，悉令下降，覆护受持是此经者。 敕命降魔力士、四天门王、五岳四渎、及余诸山、四海九江、十二河源、山林川泽、一切主者，令与眷属，覆护受持是此经者，诸险恶处令得安稳。 敕命所在一切土地灵官、并沟渠等一切诸大力鬼王，皆令覆护受持是此经者，令众魔外道，悉皆慑伏，潜形遁边，高飞海外，远避他方； 如是山林社稷祠庙血食之宾、一切鬼神，当自消灭； 五方行病瘟疫鬼帅、诸恶鬼神、并风王水怪、孽龙妖神、土精木魅，尽自消灭，五虚六耗，梦寐乖常，野道咒诅，蛊毒之类，皆自消灭； 心欲愿者，一切如意，皆得满足。 是持经人，或不依科教，未能修斋，未具净戒，以能信受尊重，景慕是此经典，并同修斋、护净戒者。 是人功德，坦然无碍，自在逍遥，号人中圣，德慧长新，同诸真人。 臣谨言曰：诵经功德，天尊已尝於前品言之矣，今昊天上帝犹以为未悉也。 复於兹时，再用启请於帝前，求有以周悉之。 此盖上圣慈心之切，必欲导斯人以持诵之事，而望上帝以优渥之恩也。 玉帝悲愿，广大无际，故於兹时，宣示明敕，始终备至，了无纤末之遗。 始於东方，而终於十方万灵，罔不毕举。 是欲世之含生凡克於经效心，则在在灵只莫不协佑也。 然帝敕之重，虽皆周悉，而玉敕之宣，首以尽忠、尽孝等事为始，盖叉能忠孝恭敬，不杀不盗，不淫不妬，不嗔不恨，不骄不诈，奉戒持斋，冥心大道，一一皆如帝言，则十方万灵然后护持，如帝之敕。 使其未然，则虽譊譊吻颊，予未保十方万灵果悉加护也。 虽然，净戒之具谓前忠孝等事也。 固玉帝责望之严。 然三界有生，根品有间，苟不别智愚而一，以是责之，则净戒之具，难乎其人也。 帝德慈悯，仁爱洪大，故於宣敕之末，复出玉音，曰：或不依科教，未能修斋具戒，以能尊慕功德，德慧同诸真人。 吁，此非玉帝之慈，不以绝法待天下，宁有此敕哉？ 钝根下士，宜体帝敕，先降尊重景慕之心，增而上之，以冀十方万灵之佑。 然不可谓帝敕容以未能修斋具戒而安於怠慢焉。 臣良谨言。 尔时昊天上帝闻是说已，即於帝前，乃为歌曰：
chunks.translated_text:
I command the **Crashing Void Heavenly Lord** of the Northeast,
with His divine hosts, immortal troops, and countless legions,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.

I command the **Central Heavenly Sovereign Emperor Kunlun the Aged**,
with His yellow cavalry of the **Kunlun Celestial Old Master**,
His divine hosts, immortal troops, and countless legions,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.

I command the **Heavenly Lord of the Upper Realm, Laihe**,
with the immortal troops of mountains and great caves,
and countless legions,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.

I command all **Golden Immortals** of the Lower Realm,
with the **Fourfold and Eightfold Assemblies** and their retinues,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.

I command the **Ten Directions of Flying Heavenly Kings**,
the **Flying Heavenly Deities**, the **Three Officials and Four Saints**,
the **Nine Bright Stars**, the **Northern Dipper and Southern Dipper**,
the **Eastern Dipper and Western Dipper**, the **Central Dipper**,
the **Twenty-Eight Constellations**, the **Circumambient Heavenly Hosts**,
the **Vajra Warriors**, and the **Divine Kings**,
each with their retinues,
to descend and protect all who uphold this scripture.

I command the **Subduing Demon Vajra Warriors**,
the **Four Heavenly Gate Kings**, the **Five Sacred Mountains and Four Great Rivers**,
and all remaining mountains,
the **Four Seas and Nine Rivers**, the **Twelve River Sources**,
the **forest spirits, water demons, and marsh demons**,
and all their rulers,
to descend with their retinues,
protecting all who uphold this scripture,
and ensuring safety in all perilous and treacherous places.

I command all **local land spirits** and **great-power ghost kings** of streams and ditches,
to protect all who uphold this scripture,
and to subdue all malevolent demons and heterodox spirits,
forcing them to shrink in fear, vanish, or flee—
soaring high into the heavens, escaping to distant shores,
or avoiding other realms.

Thus, all **mountain, forest, ancestral, and temple guests** who partake in blood sacrifices,
and all **ghosts and spirits**,
shall naturally be extinguished.

The **Five Directions’ Pestilence and Plague Ghost Marshals**,
all **evil ghosts and spirits**,
as well as the **Wind Kings and Water Monsters**,
the **Sinspawn Dragons and Demon Spirits**,
and **earthly and wooden demons**,
shall all be extinguished,
and thus the **five voids and six depletions**,
the **unusual dreams and nightmares**,
the **sorcery and curses of wild paths**,
and all **poisonous hexes and toxins**,
shall be vanquished.

For those who wish with sincerity,
all desires shall be fulfilled,
and all wishes shall be satisfied.

Those who uphold this scripture—
whether they do not follow the prescribed teachings,
cannot observe fasts,
or lack pure precepts—
yet still revere and honor its virtue,
admire and cherish this sacred text,
and also those who, together with them,
observe fasts and guard pure precepts—
their **merits and virtues** shall be boundless,
unobstructed, and free,
making them **saints among mortals**,
with ever-renewing wisdom and virtue,
equal to all **True Persons**.

Thus I humbly say:
The merits of reciting this scripture
have already been spoken of by the Heavenly Lord,
yet the **August Heavenly Emperor** still deems it incomplete.
At this time,
I again respectfully petition before the Emperor,
seeking to make it fully thorough.

This is truly the **Supreme Sage’s** compassionate heart,
desiring to guide all beings
to uphold and recite this scripture,
and hoping the Emperor will grant abundant blessings.

The **Jade Emperor’s** compassionate vow is vast and boundless,
thus at this time,
He declares and proclaims clearly,
from beginning to end,
with nothing omitted or left unfinished.
From the **East** He begins,
and to the **Ten Directions of All Spirits** He concludes,
leaving none unaccounted for.

This is to ensure that all who embrace the **scripture’s efficacy**,
whether near or far,
shall receive the **spirits’** harmonious aid.

Yet the weight of the Emperor’s decree,
though all-encompassing,
first emphasizes **loyalty, filial piety**, and such matters,
for only those who can be **loyal and filial**,
reverent and respectful,
who do not kill or steal,
who do not commit adultery or envy,
who do not harbor anger or resentment,
who do not act arrogantly or deceive,
who observe precepts and keep fasts,
who focus their minds on the **Great Dao**,
and who strictly follow each word of the Emperor’s decree—
only then shall the **Ten Directions of All Spirits** truly protect and uphold them,
as the Emperor commands.

If they fail to do so,
even if they recite with lips and cheeks,
I cannot guarantee that the **Ten Directions of All Spirits** will fully protect them.

Although **pure precepts** refer to the prior matters of loyalty and filial piety,
the Jade Emperor’s expectations are indeed strict.

Yet among the **Three Realms**,
beings differ in their **roots and capacities**,
and if one does not distinguish between the wise and the foolish,
and holds all to the same standard,
then few will truly possess these pure precepts.

The Emperor’s **virtue and power** are compassionate and boundless,
His **ren love** vast and profound,
thus at the end of His proclamation,
He again issues a **Jade Decree**, saying:

*"Even those who do not follow the prescribed teachings,
cannot observe fasts,
or lack pure precepts—
yet still revere and honor its virtue,
and whose wisdom and virtue equal that of the True Persons—
ah! This is not the Jade Emperor’s strictness,
for He does not abandon the **Way** for all under Heaven,
nor would such a decree exist otherwise.*

*The dull-witted and lowly among mortals
should heed the Emperor’s decree,
first cultivating a heart of reverence and admiration,
then ascending higher,
so as to hope for the aid of the **Ten Directions of All Spirits**.*

*Yet one cannot presume that the Emperor’s decree
will overlook those who fail to observe fasts
or keep pure precepts,
and who remain idle and negligent.*

Thus I speak with utmost care.

At that time, the **August Heavenly Emperor**, having heard these words,
immediately composed a hymn before the Emperor, saying:

chunks.original_text: 大哉至道，无形无名。 渺渺亿劫，黄道开清。 神清朗耀，九魂吐精。 玉虚澄辉，太霞高明。 玉皇开化，溥度天人。 三元道养，二象摄生。 朽树故根，已枯使荣。 蠢动蜎息，长生化形。 怀胎含孕，俱得生成。 亡者命过，魂归三清。 魄受炼度，南宫飞升。 今日大吉，皆得光明。 五帝鉴映，普告万灵。 天神地祇，及诸河源。 五岳四渎，及诸名山。 洞玄洞虚，洞空洞仙。 无极大圣，至真尊神。 无穷无极，溥监度生。 恶根断绝，玄都记名。 众真班列，咸听帝言。 经是帝敕，保诵持人。 至度道岸，无使灾侵。 我奉帝命，一切成听。 尔时昊天上帝说是歌已，告大众言：此玉皇妙法语、诸圣秘密言，路绝道断，微妙难思。 巍巍大范，为神明之宗，保镇国土，拔度生死。 尔时昊天上帝说是语时，法筵清众咸仰道言，溥得开悟。 于是天尊而说偈曰： 玉帝功德大，玄理极幽深。 生於浩劫前，运化於古今。 我今说妙经，愍念诸有情。 此诚极妙法，功德中功德。 名号最上乘，无比为第一。 大光明王尊，威德圣希有。 能破暴恶魔，皆令心降伏。 能灭极重罪，皆令得清净。 若人闻是经，或闻是帝名，稽首生恭敬，一切罪消灭。 十恶四重业，五逆害父母，信心一称名，随声尽消灭。 保护人天众，四相与五衰，三途极重苦，人间凡厄难。 凶年饥馑丧，毒药及厌魅，刑狱与冤家，军阵斗战苦。 山林恶道中，虎豹豺狼等，江海毒龙类，迅雷风雨雹。 水火及盗贼，蛊毒所中心，失志发狂乱，蛇竭毒恶虫。 邪魔凶怪神，伺求人便者，由持是真经，普皆自散灭。 恶病久沈绵，梦寐亦不安，非理欲残命，殄灭不为殃。 缘遇是经故，安稳得自在。 所有希求愿，财宝及富贵。 以此经功德，如意皆称遂。 神威自在仙，众德十一曜。 三十二天主，二十八宿王，灵妃玉女等，天神及地祇。 三界虚空神，江海诸龙王，水火及风神，宫殿与宅舍。 山林树木众，沟渠井泉神，由持是经故，一切皆拥护。 衣食常自然，子孙居富贵。 出言人希闻，所至皆恭敬。 若为求男女，诵持此真经，帝诏下天曹，落籍天仙人。 降谪生其家，为其作男女。 显贵人祟重，七祖尽升仙。 光大庆其门，延及父母亲。 吉祥常炽盛，灾障不能侵。 是故我今说，大众宜谛听。 慈悲度一切，皆令达上清。 于是天尊普告四众：凡人持念此经，受诵帝名，皆道根深重，宿有善缘。 此经尊妙，普度天人。 但精心恭奉，家国安宁，保命度灾，扫诸不祥。 天子王侯得奉之者，致国太平，凶寇自夷，边域不争，兆民歌唱，普天兴隆。 运推数周，正道当行。 有得之者，天真妙重，秘之秘之。 臣谨言曰：玉帝之敕，其丁宁周悉，已极其至也，而昊天之赞、天尊之偈，犹至於委曲周详如此。 盖上圣高真，爱人念切，以故发扬印证，不惮谆复，必欲俾众生之信奉也。 帝敕若是，而天尊天帝之言又若是，则持诵之效，当决如经之所载也。 臣良再出斯言，奉勉众生宜崇信之。 臣良馑言。 #1『玉帝』原做『上帝』，兹据白文本改。 洞玄灵宝#1报应神验品第五 尔时，慈悲度厄真人、寻声救苦真人、济生度死真人、万福护身真人，俱从座起，越班而出，俱白天尊言：若诸世末凡夫，虽宿有善缘，得遇是经，被诸邪障之污，本末疑惑，不信是经功德，如是之人，见在、过去於诸地狱得何罪报？
chunks.translated_text:
「Great is the **Dao** of Ultimate **Way**,
formless, nameless.

Vast and boundless through countless **eons**,
the Yellow **Dao** clears and opens.

Divine and bright, its radiance shines—
the Nine Souls emit their essence.

The Jade **Dao** is pure and luminous—
the Great **Xia** ascends in splendor.

The Jade Emperor manifests creation,
universally nurturing all under Heaven and **humans**.

The Three Primordials nourish the **Dao**,
the Two Symbols govern life.

Rotten trees, withered roots,
once dead, now flourish anew.

Lifeless beings stir and breathe—
transformed into **immortal** forms.

Conception and gestation alike,
all achieve birth and completion.

The departed, their **life-force** spent,
return their souls to the Three **Qing**.

Their **spirits** undergo refinement,
ascending to the Southern Palace.

This day is grand and auspicious—
all attain radiant clarity.

The Five Emperors observe and reflect,
proclaiming to all **spirits**.

Celestial **Gods** and Earthly **spirits**,
along with river deities,

the Five Sacred Peaks and Four Great Passes,
and all named mountains,

the **Tongxuan** and **Tongxu** deities,
the **Tongkong** and **Tongxian** spirits,

the **Great Sage of the Boundless**,
the **Most Venerable True One**,

Boundless and infinite in scope,
universally overseeing and refining life.

Evil roots are severed and erased,
the **Mysterious Capital** records their names.

All **True Ones** gather in ranks,
hear the Emperor’s words.

This is the Emperor’s decree—
reverently recite and uphold it.

The **Dao**’s ultimate refinement,
never allow calamity to intrude.

I obey the Emperor’s command,
all shall heed in full.

At that time, the **August Heavenly Emperor** spoke these verses,
declaring to the assembly:
*"This is the Jade Emperor’s wondrous **Dao**-utterance,
the **True Ones**’ hidden and profound words.
The path is absolute, the **Dao** is severed—
so subtle, so profound it defies thought.

Majestic and vast, the **Great Standard**,
the origin of all **Divine Clarity**,
protecting and upholding the land,
extracting and refining life and death."*

When the **Heavenly Venerable** spoke these words,
the **Law Assembly**’s pure gathering all revered the **Dao**-utterance,
universally attaining enlightenment.

Then the **Heavenly Venerable** proclaimed the **gāthā**:
*"The Jade Emperor’s virtue is vast,
His **mysterious principles** most profound.
Born before the **Great Calamity**,
His transformations span ancient and modern times.

Now I expound this **wondrous sutra**,
out of compassion for all **sentient beings**.
This is indeed the **most supreme dharma**,
the greatest of all virtues.

The **name** of the highest **vehicle**,
unmatched, the first among equals.

The **Great Radiant Sovereign**’s awe-inspiring **virtue**,
His saintly **power** rare and wondrous.

He can subdue the violent and malevolent **demons**,
all make their hearts bow in submission.

He can erase the most grievous **karma**,
all attain **purity** and **clarity**.

If mortals hear this **sutra**,
or hear the Emperor’s **name**,
and bow in **devotion**,
all their **sins** shall vanish and be extinguished.

The **Ten Evils** and **Four Great Transgressions**,
the **Five Great Filial Disobediences** that harm parents—
with **faith** and but one invocation,
all their **karmic retributions** dissolve with the sound.

He protects **human** and **celestial** assemblies,
from the **Four Signs of Decay** to the **Five Great Calamities**,
from the **Three Paths of Suffering** to mortal **afflictions** in the human realm.

Years of famine and pestilence,
poisonous drugs and **malevolent charms**,
unjust trials and **enemies of fate**,
battles in the **army’s encampments**—all their torments.

In the **wilds**, malevolent **paths**,
where **tigers**, **leopards**, wolves, and **jackals** dwell,
in the **seas**, venomous **dragons**,
and the swift **thunder**, **winds**, and **hail**.

**Water**, **fire**, and **thieves**,
**poisonous curses** of the heart,
losing **mind** and descending into madness,
**snakes**, **demons**, and **evil insects**.

Wicked **demons**, fierce **spirits**, and **gods**,
who lurk to seize mortal opportunities—
through holding this **true sutra**,
all disperse and perish of their own accord.

Prolonged **illnesses** and lingering **suffering**,
restless even in dreams—
unjust desires that seek to **destroy life**,
extermination shall not bring **retribution** as their **fate**.

By encountering this **sutra**,
one attains **peace** and **freedom**.

All **wishes** for **blessings**,
wealth and **honor**—
through this **sutra**’s virtue,
all shall be fulfilled as one’s **heart’s desire**.

**Gods of威** and **自在**,
all **virtues** of the **Eleven Luminaries**,
the **Thirty-two Heavenly Sovereigns**,
the **Twenty-eight Constellations’ Kings**,
the **Spiritual Consorts** and **Jade Maidens**,
**celestial gods** and **earthly spirits**.

The **Three Realms’ deities**, the **void’s spirits**,
all **dragon kings** of the **rivers and seas**,
**gods of water**, **fire**, and **wind**,
palaces and **dwellings** alike.

The **multitudes** of **mountains, forests, trees**,
and **spirits** of **gullies, ditches, wells, and springs**—
through holding this **sutra**,
all shall guard and protect.

**Clothing and food** shall come naturally,
**children and grandchildren** dwell in **wealth and honor**.

Words spoken shall be **rarely heard**,
wherever one goes, all shall show **reverence**.

If seeking **sons or daughters**,
recite and uphold this **true sutra**,
the Emperor’s decree descends to the **Heavenly Registries**,
and **heavenly beings** are born in their **families**.

As **noble offspring**, they are **venerated and honored**,
the **seven generations** all ascend to **immortality**.

Their **gates** are illuminated in **glory**,
extending even to their **parents**.
**Auspiciousness** burns ever bright and grand,
**calamities** cannot intrude.

Thus I now proclaim—
all should listen with **earnest attention**.
With **compassion**, all are refined to **Upper Purity**."

Then the **Heavenly Venerable** universally declared to the **Four Assemblies**:
*"Mortals who hold and recite this **sutra**,
who receive the Emperor’s **name**,
have deep **Dao-roots** and **karmic affinities**.
This **sutra** is most **venerable and wondrous**,
universally refining **heavenly beings** and **humans**.

But with **sincere hearts** and **reverent devotion**,
their **families and nations** shall be **at peace**,
their **lives protected**, **calamities averted**,
all **inauspiciousness** swept away.

**Kings and nobles** who uphold it,
shall bring **great peace** to their **realms**,
**wicked invaders** shall be **pacified**,
**borderlands** shall not be **contested**,
the **myriad people** shall **sing in joy**,
and all under **Heaven** shall **thrive**.

The **cosmic cycles** shall be **propelled**,
the **true path** shall **prevail**.
Those who obtain it,
shall be **Heaven’s True Ones**, most **venerable**—
it must be **kept secret**, most **secret**.

I speak with utmost **earnestness**:
*The Jade Emperor’s decree,
its **urgent warnings** are thorough and complete,
already reaching the utmost **truth**,
yet the **August Heavenly Emperor’s** praise
and the **Heavenly Venerable’s** **gāthā**
are still so **detailed and meticulous**.

For the **Supreme Saints** and **Highest True Ones**,
their love for mortals is profound—
thus they **display and verify**,
unwearied in **repetition**,
determined that all **sentient beings** shall **believe and uphold**.

If the Emperor’s decree is thus,
and the **Heavenly Venerable’s** words are likewise,
then the **effects** of recitation
shall **unfailingly** match the **sutra**’s **recordings**.

I speak again to **urge all mortals** to **cherish and believe**.
I speak no more.

---
*At that time, the **Compassionate and Merciful True Person Who Degrees Suffering**,
the **True Person Who Seeks Voices to Save Pain**,
the **True Person Who Rescues Life and Degrees Death**,
and the **True Person Who Bestows Ten Thousand Blessings and Guards the Body**,
all rose from their seats,
stepped beyond their ranks,
and together addressed the **Heavenly Venerable**:
*"If mortals in the **end times**,
though they have **karmic affinities** from past lives,
encounter this **sutra**,
yet are **defiled by malevolent spirits**,
and **doubt and confusion** pervade their **beginning and end**,
not believing in this **sutra**’s virtue—

**now and in the past** in all the **hells**?"*

chunks.original_text: 惟愿圣慈，说其报应恶趣之苦。 是时天尊谓四真人云：若诸世间刚强暴恶不善众生，终日竟夜，对诸道像，无恭敬心，出诽谤语，是罪当堕五无间狱。 若得值遇是持经人，设诸方便，诱引劝谕，如是之人暂灭恶心，信向是经，彼人罪业净尽无余。 又若有邪见愚执恶人，睹持是经，生诸恶逆，偏眼邪视，乃至起一恶心，发一恶言，谤黩如是持经之人，其罪过是，命终之后，堕大地狱，永无出期。 何况世间众生，得遇是经，不生敬仰，秽手污触，荤口读诵，床榻不净，便将安置，或读是经，讲习俗语，共同戏笑，以为常典。 如是之人，命过之后，堕无间狱，永无出期，殃缘九祖，受考酆都，累及后世，害缠子孙。 是人于地狱中，历无量劫，受大苦恼，遇无边圣，累承救拔，罪恶小减。 又遇圣人救拔，得出生饿鬼中，历千万劫，不闻浆水之名。 鬼报得出，生畜生中。 畜生报出，若生人中，更生边夷、外道，而复女身，贫寒困苦，癃残百病，受无量苦，人所弃掷，求生不得，求死不得。 轻斯经故，获罪如是。 又若复有人，初虽信受，后复慢易，善恶童子上奏三官，黑簿添名、青编减算，身殁之后，拘闭幽牢，往复三途，无由解脱； 或於现世受种种病，疥癫廱疽#2，以为果报#3，忧悲苦恼，日夜相煎； 而身或被横恶所加，或牢狱系锁，非分自害，误食毒药，或被虎狼毒蛇之所食啖或为冤家之所雠对，或行山林，值遇恶人，被他屠割，推落崖岸，或被邪精魍魉之所残害，或值水火之所焚漂，或被刀兵之所横诛。 轻斯经故，横丧天年，获如是果。 可不悲欤，可不痛欤。 故报汝等，依此奉行，勿生邪念。 若诸念不生，万缘顿息，尘沙恶业随心消散，一切灾魔自然殄灭，此之功德，不可思议。 是诚无比最上妙法，诸经之王，有大利益。 非人勿示。 人能不生邪念，顿息业缘，是谓大利益法门也。 若诸天人，五衰四相，轮回侵逼，能舍除妄想，受持是经，坐招自然，天福益固，身度三界，与道长存。 是此经典，无与等，无能胜，是大威德，大神咒，能令一切枯槁便生枝叶，花果茂盛，能除众生极重苦恼，能令短命众生而得长寿。 此经功德，不可思议，叹莫能尽。 若不宿植道种#4，广种福业，乃至名字亦不得闻，何况得见是经。 依三洞真格，八万劫一传。 此清都至真上圣所宝，秘於玉京金阙宸宫，甚为微妙，难可得遇此经#5宿有仙骨，当为九天真仙之人，得遇斯文，承斯缘故，后当赍金宝，从盟师受之#6，方当乘机应运，乃可付焉。 不得轻泄，敬之慎之。 臣谨言曰：臣尝闻之经书曰，谛观法界性，一切惟心造。
chunks.translated_text:
I now humbly pray to Your Sacred Mercy
to speak of the sufferings of the **karmic retributions in evil realms**.

At that time, the **Heavenly Venerable** addressed the four **True Persons**:
*"For those fierce, violent, and wicked beings in the world,
who day and night stand before **Dao/Way** images
without reverence,
uttering blasphemous words—
their crime deserves to fall into the **Five Uninterrupted Hells**.
Yet if they encounter one who upholds this **sutra**,
who through all means entices and persuades them,
and thus temporarily extinguish their evil thoughts,
and take faith in this **sutra**,
then their crimes and karmic debts are utterly purified, leaving no trace.

Again, if there are those with perverse views and stubborn delusions,
who see one reciting this **sutra**,
and harbor malice,
casting sidelong glances or even harboring a single evil thought,
uttering a single evil word,
defaming and slandering those who uphold this **sutra**—
their offense is such that,
after death,
they fall into the **Great Hell**,
with no hope of escape.

How much worse for those in the world
who encounter this **sutra**,
yet fail to show reverence,
touching it with impure hands,
reciting it with unclean mouths,
placing it on defiled beds,
or reading it aloud while speaking vulgarities,
laughing and jesting as if it were a common text.
Such beings,
after death,
fall into the **Uninterrupted Hell**,
with no hope of escape.
Their misfortunes extend to nine generations,
suffering under the **Nine Judges of the Underworld**,
afflicting their descendants through endless calamities.
In the **Hell Realms**, they endure unimaginable suffering for countless eons,
encountering countless **Sages** who repeatedly rescue them,
yet their crimes diminish only slightly.

Again, when rescued by a **Sage** and reborn as a **Hungry Ghost**,
they wander for thousands of millions of eons,
never hearing the name of water or food.
When their **Ghostly Retribution** ends,
they are reborn as **Animals**,
and from there,
if reborn as humans,
they become barbarians, heretics,
or are born as women,
suffering poverty, deformity, and a hundred ailments,
enduring unimaginable torments,
cast aside by all,
neither able to live nor die.
Thus, those who slight this **sutra** incur such karmic consequences.

Again, if there are those who,
though initially believing,
later grow negligent and arrogant—
the **Youths of Virtue and Vice** report them to the **Three Officials**,
their names are added to the **Black Registers**,
their merits subtracted from the **Blue Ledgers**,
and after death,
they are imprisoned in dark dungeons,
trapped in the **Three Paths of Retribution**,
with no means of liberation.
Or in this very life,
they suffer countless diseases—
**scabies, epilepsy, leprosy, and ulcers**—
as their just retribution.
They are tormented by sorrow and suffering day and night;
or they are harmed by violent forces,
imprisoned in chains,
wrongfully taking their own lives,
poisoned by toxins,
devoured by tigers, wolves, or venomous snakes,
slain by enemies,
or while wandering in mountains and forests,
they are slaughtered by bandits,
pushed from cliffs,
or ravaged by malevolent spirits and demons.
Or they perish in fires, floods,
or by the blades of weapons.
Thus, those who slight this **sutra** meet untimely deaths,
reaping such fruits.

How can one not grieve?
How can one not lament?
Therefore, I declare to you:
Follow this teaching faithfully,
and do not harbor evil thoughts.
If no evil thoughts arise,
all entanglements cease,
and the **sand-like evil karmas** dissolve with the mind.
All calamities and demons vanish naturally.
The virtue of this is beyond measure—
a **supreme, matchless, wondrous **Dharma**,
the **King of all **sutras**,
with great benefit.
Do not reveal this to the **unworthy**.

If mortals refrain from evil thoughts,
cutting off all karmic ties,
this is the **Great Beneficial Path**.

If **celestial beings** in their **Five Decays** and **Four Signs of Decline**,
facing the encroachment of **reincarnation**,
can abandon delusion,
uphold this **sutra**,
and recite it naturally,
their **celestial blessings** grow ever stronger,
their bodies transcend the **Three Realms**,
and they abide eternally with the **Dao**.

This **scripture** is unmatched,
unequaled,
possessing **great virtue and power**,
a **great divine spell**—
it can make withered things sprout leaves and fruit,
remove the heaviest sufferings of beings,
and grant longevity to those with short lives.
Its virtues are beyond comprehension,
beyond all praise.

If one has not sown the **seeds of the Dao** in past lives,
or cultivated vast **meritorious deeds**,
they may not even hear its name,
let alone encounter this **sutra**.
According to the **Three Caverns’ True Principles**,
it is transmitted only once every **eighty thousand eons**.

This **pure and exalted scripture** is treasured
in the **Celestial Capital’s Golden Gates and Imperial Palace**,
exceedingly subtle and rare—
only those with **inherent Daoist essence**,
destined to become **Nine-Heaven True Immortals**,
may encounter this text.
Through this fateful connection,
they shall later offer **gold and jewels**
to their **盟师 (盟师—*méngshī*, "pledge-master" or "covenant teacher")**
and receive it,
only then may they ride the **celestial timing** to pass it on.
Do not reveal it lightly—
revere it and guard it carefully.

I humbly declare:
I have heard in the **scriptures** that
*"To truly observe the **Dharma Realm’s nature**,
all things are shaped by the mind."*

chunks.original_text: 此语如宣说，以为破地狱偈。 是知心生则地狱生，心灭则地狱灭也。 心之生灭，地狱之有无，况心不止於生而又至於起恶哉。 是以《尊经报应品》中谓凡夫造罪，无量无边，苟能暂灭恶心，则一切罪业遂至於尽 净无余，而起一恶心，则其罪其殃，有非言之可尽者。 是知方寸之间，乃利害之机、升沈之本，岂容不谨之、畏之哉？ 品中下文又载一切天人，或有五衰四相之起，能舍除妄想，则天福益固。 盖想者，即心之所起也。 人与天相去辽邈，然升沈利害，切由一心。 吁，心果可纵哉？ 心果可晦哉？ 傥一切众生，未能俾心之不生，则亦宜勿起恶心，舍除妄想，使诸念不生，万缘顿息，庶几尘沙恶业随心消散，得以为善人。 君子之归则於斯经，乃为无愧。 所谓灾魔之殄，万灵之护，帝恩之及，当如影随形也。 又能广而充之，俾心若太虚，内外贞白，无所不容，无所不纳，直诣天尊真一不二法门，高证清 净解脱之道，则一十二真人之位、玉帝三身之果，有不难至也。 众生宜勉之。 臣良谨言。

This teaching, if proclaimed aloud,
is said to shatter the hells’ *gāthā*[1].
Thus it is known:
when the mind arises, the hells arise;
when the mind is extinguished, the hells are extinguished.
The arising and ceasing of the mind,
the existence and nonexistence of the hells—
how much more so when the mind does not merely arise
but further gives rise to evil!

Therefore, in the *Chánjīng Bàoyìng Pǐn*[2],
it is stated that the common mortal’s transgressions
are boundless and limitless.
If one can but briefly extinguish the evil mind,
then all crimes and karmic burdens
shall be utterly exhausted,
leaving no trace behind.
Yet to harbor even a single evil thought,
its calamities and sufferings
are beyond measure—
what need for words to describe them?

Thus it is known that within the four-square inches of the heart,
lies the pivot of gain and harm,
the root of ascent and descent—
how can one dare to be negligent,
how can one dare to fear it not?

Further below in the *pǐn*[3],
it is recorded that all heavenly beings and mortals,
should they encounter the five decayed or four afflicted states,
if they abandon delusion and false thought,
then their celestial blessings shall be ever more secure.
False thought is but the mind’s arising.

Though mortals and heavenly beings differ vastly,
yet ascent and descent, gain and harm,
all hinge upon the single mind.
Alas, can the mind truly be left unchecked?
Can the mind truly be left in darkness?

If all beings cannot yet prevent the mind from arising,
then they should at least refrain from giving rise to evil,
abandon false thought,
so that all notions cease,
all entanglements subside—
perhaps then the dust-like evil deeds
shall dissolve with the mind,
and they may become virtuous folk.
The worthy scholar’s return lies here:
this text is their unshamed refuge.

The destruction of calamity-demons,
the protection of all life,
the reach of the Emperor’s grace—
these shall follow like shadow to form.

If one further expands and fulfills this,
making the mind like the boundless void,
pure and flawless within and without,
accepting all without exclusion,
embracing all without rejection,
and directly attaining the **True One’s Unobstructed Dao Gate**,
the **High Path of Pure Liberation**—
then the station of the **Twelve Heavenly Worthies**,
the fruit of the **Jade Sovereign’s Three Bodies**[4],
shall not be difficult to reach.

All beings should strive earnestly.
I, your subject, speak with utmost sincerity.

chunks.original_text: 於是天尊重宣此义，为说偈曰： 设使江河水，波浪能生莲，慈乌毛能白，如经故难遇。 设使龟生毛，堪采为衣服，夜月能消冰，如经故难遇。 设使蚊蠓足，堪构为舟桥，能载一切重，如经故难遇。 设使黄口雀，能衔诸大山，掷之他方界，如经故难遇。 设使一叶舟，力能载昆仑，浮渡於大海，如经故难遇。 若使诸水蛭，口能生巨齿，其大如象牙，如经故难遇。 设使蓬蒿叶，能覆无鞅界，荫芘无鞅众，如经故难遇。 设使乌枭类，同树一巢栖，衔食共相食，如经故难遇。 设使兔生角，堪用为梯磴，上穷有顶天，如经故难遇。 设使鼷鼠等，缘於兔角梯，至天能食月，如经故难遇。 设使驴颜唇，色如苹婆果，复能作歌舞，如经故难遇。 设使蝇虫等，能饮钟石酒，迷荒而沈醉，如经故难遇。 尔时，天尊宣说偈已，溥告#7四众：是故持是经人，名功德身，一切有情，被其荫故。 持是经人，名神通身，一切吉祥，咸臻集故。 持是经人，名清 净身，是诸恶业，不能侵故。 持是经人，名威德身，天魔异道，不能摄故。 持是经人，名无等身，上帝遥唱，万神敬故。 持是经人，名坚固身，恶劫大难，不能损故。 持是经人，名道藏身，口出语言，鬼神仰故。 持是经人，名慈悲身，六道众生，赖其善故。 持是经人，名大道身，出入所在，无怖畏故。 持是经人，名良医身，善行妙法，安乐人故。 持是经人，名光明身，常为帝光，所摄受故。 持是经人，名自在身，天宫妙境，神能游故。 持是经人功德，说不可尽。 臣谨言曰：天书仙格，不可泛示下世，故经中动以勿示非人、妄传轻泄为戒。 然末世众生，昏迷不悟，傥不示以径级，则善念不萌，功德无积。 所以天尊说经，虽以宝秘为戒，而玄蕴妙义，辄宣惕之不惜。 此盖上圣之慈悯也。 臣奉旨校经，敢援是则，所以采摘妙义，列造经中。 今经中修证果位虽未尝准经文之示三，辄为传之。 《报应品》中载天尊言，持经之人所证诸身天府，今列此为真人之位，谓如名功德身，即功德真人之位是也。 众生有能勉奉是经，诵持不退，当直证此真人之位。 今四天选举司见有升陟是位者。 众生宜坚确念虑，口诵心持，俾勿犯诸戒，俾依如玉音，求以上证此品，则九族蒙恩，七玄受炼，非独此身减灾得福也。 敬信无怠，同会瑶华。 卑言苦祝，望毋疑惑。

Then the **True One** (天尊) solemnly expounded this meaning and spoke in verse:

If the waters of the Yangtze and Yellow Rivers
Could spawn lotuses from their waves,
If a loving crow’s feathers turned white,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If tortoises bore hair,
Fit for weaving into robes,
If moonlight at night could melt ice,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If gnats and mosquitoes had feet,
Capable of building bridges and boats,
And bore all burdens heavy,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If a fledgling bird could carry great mountains,
And cast them into distant realms,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If a single-leaf boat held strength
To bear the Kunlun peaks,
And float across the vast sea,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If leeches could sprout colossal fangs,
As large as elephant tusks,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If the leaves of broom and hemp
Could shelter the boundless **Jade Sovereign’s** (无鞅) domain,
And shade the **Jade Sovereign’s** countless multitudes,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If crows and kites of the same kind
Shared one nest in a single tree,
And fed each other in mutual trust,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If rabbits sprouted horns,
Fit for use as ladders and stairs,
And reached the **Highest Heaven** (有顶天),
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If shrews and rats climbed
The rabbit’s horned ladder,
And devoured the moon in the sky,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If a donkey’s lips were as red
As the **Bodhi fruit** (苹婆果),
And it could sing and dance with grace,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

If flies and insects drank
From cups of **Jade Stone wine** (钟石酒),
And drowned in intoxication,
Such wonders would still be rare as scripture’s truth.

At that time, having finished expounding these verses,
The **True One** universally declared to the **Four Assemblies** (四众):

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Meritorious Body** (功德身),
For all sentient beings
Are sheltered by its grace.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Divine Power Body** (神通身),
For all auspicious blessings
Shall gather unto them.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Pure Body** (清净身),
For all defilements and evil deeds
Shall never touch them.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Mighty Virtue Body** (威德身),
For celestial demons and heterodox paths
Shall never ensnare them.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Peerless Body** (无等身),
For the **Supreme Deities** (上帝) shall summon them afar,
And all spirits shall bow in reverence.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Unshakable Body** (坚固身),
For even in the **Great Calamity** (恶劫) of woe,
They shall remain unharmed.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Dao Treasury Body** (道藏身),
For their words, once spoken,
Shall be obeyed by spirits and gods.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Compassionate Body** (慈悲身),
For all beings in the **Six Realms** (六道)
Depend upon its benevolence.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Great Dao Body** (大道身),
For wherever they go,
No fear shall bind them.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Skilled Physician Body** (良医身),
For their wondrous and efficacious methods
Shall bring comfort and ease to all.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Radiant Body** (光明身),
For they shall forever be the Emperor’s light,
Illuminating all who receive them.

Those who uphold this scripture
Are called the **Omnipotent Body** (自在身),
For they shall traverse the **Celestial Palaces** (天宫) and **Mystic Realms** (妙境),
And spirits shall guide them.

The merits of those who uphold this scripture
Are beyond measure to recount.

Your humble subject, having received the imperial command to verify the scripture,
Dares to cite these verses,
Thus selecting and compiling its profound truths
Within the sacred text.

Though the scripture’s **modifications and verifications** (修证) of **fruit and station** (果位) have not always aligned with the **Three Revelations** (准经文之示三) of the original,
I have nonetheless transmitted them.

The *Chapter on Retribution* (报应品) records the **True One’s** words:
The **Heavenly Abodes** (天府) attained by those who uphold the scripture
Are now enumerated as the **True One’s station** (真人之位).
For instance, the **Meritorious Body** (功德身)
Is the station of the **Meritorious True One** (功德真人).

All beings who earnestly devote themselves to this scripture,
Reciting and upholding it without retreat,
Shall directly attain these **True One’s stations**.

Now, the **Four Heavenly Selectors** (四天选举司) have seen those ascending to these stations.

All beings should steadfastly resolve their thoughts,
Recite with their mouths and hold in their hearts,
Lest they violate any precepts,
And thus align with the **Jade Sovereign’s Voice** (如玉音),
Seeking to ascend and verify this chapter.
Then the **Nine Clans** (九族) shall receive blessings,
And the **Seven Mystic Classes** (七玄) shall undergo refinement,
Not only shall this body be free from calamity and gain fortune.

Hold fast in reverence without slackening,
And gather at the **Jade Flower Assembly** (瑶华).
Your lowly subject earnestly prays,
Hoping you will not doubt or be confused.

then the station of the **Twelve Heavenly Worthies**,
the fruit of the **Jade Sovereign’s Three Bodies**[4],
shall not be difficult to reach.

All beings should strive earnestly.
I, your subject, speak with utmost sincerity.

chunks.original_text: 臣良谨言。 又若道士志人，能结坛诵经，着新净衣，於半夜后，阗寂独处清净室中，叩齿九通，东向端坐，诵咏是经。 於是时也，太真御几，玉妃拂筵，万神班列，诸天临坛，三界侍卫，五帝司迎，然后闭目静思，存想是经，不觉身处五云之内，俄见其身光明赫奕，上升天宫，众真下迎，心有所请，一切应奉，仙丹妙宝，随意自取。 故当依科闭心，奉行此经，乃至三世金仙、十方大圣，皆从此经，依按修奉，故顿得超证无上妙道。 是此帝也，诸天之师，众圣之王。 是故凡夫值遇是经，致五帝辅翼，召使神仙，御役神官，运导阴阳，千灵敬仰，万神慑伏，百邪避路，群魔束形。 命过之后，即得南宫受炼，飞步上清，逍遥自在，与道长存。 又设复世间众生曾闻#8是经，心常渴仰，能於家中择清净处，画帝形像，日夜虔虔，晨昏济济，香花灯果，尊重供养，称名瞻礼，是人当得三十种上妙功德： 一者诸仙赞重，二者先亡生天，三者宿殃解脱，四者所往通达， 五者无盗贼事，六者所求遂心，七者除水火厄，八者横事潜消， 九者夜梦吉祥，十者疾病不临，十一者智慧聪明，十二者人见欢喜， 十三者衣食丰盛，十四者子孙荣贵，十五者六亲见喜，十六者门族和睦，十七者除三恶报，十八者转女成男，十九者形容端严，二十者为国大臣，二十一者生为帝王，二十二者鬼神钦仰，二十三者得宿命通，二十四者诸神护念，二十五者九族受荫，二十六者处世长年，二十七者有情赖善，二十八者魔王保迎，二十九者决超三界，三十者白日上升。 尔时，天尊复告四众：此经功德，能碎铁围诸山，竭苦海水，破大地狱，拔重罪苦，降暴恶魔，护诸国土，能灭一切恶鬼，能除一切重病，能解一切恶毒，能离#9 一切恶人，能伏一切毒兽，能摧一切邪道，一切诸天，皆令降伏。 其余功德，说不可尽。 尔时，道场大众、金仙菩萨、真圣眷属闻是说已，欢喜踊跃，稽首敬礼，而作颂曰： 大哉至道，无宗上真。 上度诸天，下济幽魂。 上无师祖，惟道为身。 丹台紫府，金阙玉京， 秘此妙法，溥福含灵。 灭我万罪，增我遐龄。 万神朝礼，魔王保迎。 功德昌盛，黄箓书名。 渺渺亿劫，使我长存。 於是众等说是颂毕，稽首归依#10，奉辞而退。 臣谨言曰：尊莫尊於诸天也，而大弥罗天乃天中之天； 贵莫贵於诸帝也，而玉皇上帝乃帝中之帝。 故天尊言曰：是此帝也，诸天之师，众圣之王。 惟是帝处至尊至贵之位，无与等，无能胜，是以众生能萌尊重之心，则功德无有与之并者。 或起轻慢之心，罪报亦无有与之并者。 所谓三十种上妙功德，特天尊举其要略，而品中具载罪报，亦天尊姑言其梗也。 众生苟有庆幸，得观是经，宜三复玩味。 即良此言，始终反复，观之於是经也。 留神储思，勉勉诵持，积至三年，功德无量。 臣既奉校经之旨，谨专具奏，仰乞帝旨，专署一司，校箓诵持《玉皇本行经》之人所积功绩，以示神报。 帝德慈悯，必俞所请也。 经末示此，众生宜知之。 臣良谨言。 高上玉皇本行集经卷下竟 #1 白文本无『洞玄灵宝』四字。 #2 『疽』 原作『症』，误。 兹据白文本改。 #3 『果报』，原作－庄严，误。
chunks.translated_text:
Your humble servant speaks with utmost reverence:

Moreover, if a Daoist adept or devout practitioner, having established the ritual platform and recited this scripture, dons fresh and pure garments, and in the dead of night, abides alone in a serene and spotless chamber, strikes his teeth nine times, faces east, and sits upright, reciting and chanting this scripture—then at that moment, the **Supreme True One** (太真) presides at the desk, the **Jade Consort** (玉妃) sweeps the banquet, ten thousand spirits array themselves in ranks, all the heavens descend upon the platform, the Three Realms stand guard, the Five Emperors oversee the welcome, and thereafter, with eyes closed and mind still, they focus their thoughts upon this scripture. Unbeknownst to them, they find themselves within the Five Clouds, and soon their body radiates a brilliant light, ascending to the Celestial Palace, where the **Immortal Worthies** descend to greet them. Whatever their heart desires is granted, and they may freely take elixirs and treasures of the Dao. Thus, one must follow the ritual method, close their heart to distractions, and uphold this scripture. Even the **Three-World Golden Immortals** and **Ten-Direction Great Saints** all depend upon this scripture for their practices, thereby attaining the **Supreme Wondrous Dao** in an instant.

This is the **Celestial Sovereign**—the **Teacher of All Heavens** and the **King of All Saints**. Therefore, even the common mortal who encounters this scripture shall receive the Five Emperors’ patronage, summoning spirits and immortals, commanding celestial officials, regulating yin and yang, earning the reverence of myriad spirits, and subduing ten thousand deities. Malevolent forces flee in terror, and all demons are bound in form. After death, they shall ascend to the **Southern Palace** for refinement, tread the **Flying Steps to Upper Purity**, and wander freely in eternal Dao.

Furthermore, even if a worldly being has merely heard of this scripture and harbors constant longing, they may, within their home, select a pure place, draw the **Celestial Sovereign’s** likeness, and with utmost devotion, morning and evening, offer incense, flowers, lamps, and fruits in reverent worship, invoking the name and paying homage. Such a person shall attain **thirty kinds of supreme wondrous virtues**:
1. Praise from all immortals,
2. Ascension to heaven for the deceased,
3. Liberation from past calamities,
4. Smooth passage wherever they go,
5. Freedom from theft and robbery,
6. All desires fulfilled,
7. Protection from water and fire disasters,
8. Concealment from all misfortune,
9. Auspicious dreams at night,
10. No sickness afflicting them,
11. Wisdom and keen intelligence,
12. Universal joy upon meeting others,
13. Abundant clothing and food,
14. Honorable descendants,
15. Joy from relatives,
16. Harmony within the clan,
17. Escape from the three evil retributions,
18. Transformation from female to male,
19. Noble and dignified appearance,
20. Appointment as a great minister of the realm,
21. Birth as an emperor,
22. Reverence from ghosts and spirits,
23. Knowledge of past lives,
24. Protection by all deities,
25. Blessings upon the Nine Clans,
26. Longevity in this world,
27. Dependence of all sentient beings upon their virtue,
28. The **Demon King’s** protection and welcome,
29. Transcendence of the Three Realms,
30. Ascension in broad daylight.

At that time, the **Celestial Worthy** further declared to the Four Assemblies: *"The virtues of this scripture can shatter iron-clad mountains, drain the waters of the Sea of Suffering, break the Great Hell, uproot profound sins, subdue violent demon kings, protect all lands, extinguish all malevolent ghosts, cure all grave illnesses, dissolve all poisons, sever ties with all wicked beings, subdue all venomous beasts, and crush all heretical paths. All the heavens shall bow in submission. Its remaining virtues are too vast to enumerate."*

When the **Dao Assembly**, **Golden Immortals**, **Bodhisattvas of Truth**, and the **Consorts of the Saints** heard these words, they rejoiced, leapt for joy, bowed in reverence, and composed this hymn:

*"Great is the Supreme Dao, without equal among the Highest True Ones.
Above, it transcends all heavens; below, it rescues the lost souls.
Above, it has no teachers or ancestors—only the Dao as its body.
In the **Dan Platform** and **Purple Bureaus**, the **Golden Gates** and **Jade Capitals**,
This wondrous law is kept in secret, bestowing boundless blessings upon all sentient life.
It annihilates my ten thousand sins, extending my years of life.
Ten thousand spirits pay homage, the Demon King welcomes me in protection.
Its virtues flourish eternally, inscribed in the **Yellow Register**.
Through countless eons, it grants me eternal existence."*

Thus, the assembly finished their hymn, bowed in homage, and withdrew with reverence. Your humble servant speaks: *"None is more august than the heavens, yet **Mahāraja Heaven** is the heaven of heavens; none is more noble than the emperors, yet the **Jade Emperor of the Supreme** is the emperor of emperors."* Therefore, the **Celestial Worthy** declared: *"This is the Emperor—Teacher of All Heavens, King of All Saints."*

Since this Emperor occupies the most exalted and noble position, unmatched and unconquerable, those who harbor reverence shall attain virtues without equal. Those who harbor disdain shall incur retributions without equal. The **thirty kinds of supreme wondrous virtues** are but the **Celestial Worthy’s** summary; the full account of sins and retributions is detailed within the chapter itself—a mere outline spoken by the **Celestial Worthy**.

If beings seek fortune and encounter this scripture, they should ponder it thrice. Reflect upon its beginning and end, its words and meanings, storing its essence in their minds. Strive to recite and uphold it diligently for three years, accumulating boundless merit.

Having received the edict to collate this scripture, your humble servant respectfully petitions to establish a dedicated bureau to record the merits accumulated by those who copy, recite, and uphold the *Jade Emperor’s Biographies and Scriptures*, demonstrating divine retribution. The Emperor’s benevolence shall surely grant this request.

This is the conclusion of the scripture—let all beings take heed.

Your humble servant speaks with utmost reverence.
**The Complete Scriptures of the Jade Emperor’s Biographies and Deeds, Volume Complete.**

chunks.original_text: 兹据白文本改。 #4 『道种』，白文本作『道本』，是。 #5白文本无『此经』二字。 #6 『从盟师受之』，白文本作『从师告盟受之』是。 #7 『溥』，白文本作『普』。 #8 『会闻』，白文本作『曾闻』，是。 #9 『离』，原作『灭』。 兹据白文本改。 #10 『归』，白文本作『皈』。 洞真部本文类 高上玉皇本行集经(二) 张良校释本 奏陈表文 臣昨奉诏，校正《本行集经》，恭准宸翰，令臣俟毕奏阵者。 臣闻：垂世立教，舍上智以奚堪； 删诗定书，必圣人而后可。 盖典诰示斯民之绳准，而诂训为格言之荃蹄。 傥一字之弗谆，实万世之取误。 故述而不作者，先哲所重； 而辞弗能措者，大儒莫膺。 信系属之非轻，致倚任之不易。 恭惟《玉皇本行集经》秘传金口，妙蕴琼宫，下仙难可获闻，浊世罕能忽见。 玄义邃沧溟之远，真机崇昆岳之高。 言言彰解脱之门，语语鼓清净之吹。 叹之莫尽，即以奚穷。 偶历时之过多，忽传本之致误。 点雾固何伤於日月，小疵庸曷损於琼瑶。 岂期圣虑之过慈，犹欲宝文之全善。 诞颁温诏，宠命愚臣，俾櫖狂斐之才，直膺提证之职。 纶音震响，耳然蠢听之琳琅； 宸翰挥扬，豁尔尘襟之开廓。 臣逊辞惟切，委畀寖隆。 顾猥贱之非材，第忪栗而抱愧。 重付眷怀之难咈，用驱驽质而敬承。 喜惧交驰，谦伏靡暇。 敬竭爝火之见，仰助阳晖之明。 於卷首则摘品而分章，至次编则总意而明义。 证谬者三十有八，更乖误者四十有三。 虽始终品秩，犹未殚参校之全； 而前后句音，尚不罄搜抉之备。 第为人世流传之久，恐重民间疑惑之多。 姑令大体之弗疏，故即小节而致简。 至如指摘委舛，不敢如布缕之详； 抉剔幽玄，未获若开条之悉。 盖虑多多为语，乙乙必书，繁则取厌於玩阅之劳，演则贾疑於参味之审。 其他更革，悉未周完。 谨缮录以进呈，乞矜容而阅视。 傥有纤毫之裨补，愿干明韶之颁行。 或乞申命有司，再详要义，庶免《三传》散《春秋》之诮，及无九师微《易》道之讥。 臣良刳抉肺肝，玷尘聪眷，并丐哀原冒昧之责，俾得服勤职守之卑，誓竭金石之诚，上荷海岳之惠。 臣良下情无任，瞻天望圣，悚栗战惧，俯伏待罪之至。 谨具表奏闻，伏候敕旨。 年　月　日　臣　良　表。 恭准批答云 详奏及阅所上校正经文讫。 卿仁念粹和，文华焕灿，精效参详之思，审加订证之勤。 岂徒谬语之复真，抑且妙义之抉奥。 矧襟怀之温厚，故文字之清醇。 灼识情诚，重劳精思，宜下玉宸内殿收贮，及颁韶诸天，从此诵持； 并可命南洲及诸洲演化众真照此传行，毋得亵慢。 外赐尔九光宝节、八景珍舆，以旌劳绩，切宜祇受，副此眷怀。 故兹批答，想宜知悉。 月　日　下

Your servant, having received the imperial decree, has now diligently collated *The Complete Scriptures of the Jade Emperor’s Biographies and Deeds* (高上玉皇本行集经), respectfully awaiting the completion of the petition to present the corrected text.

Your servant hears that:
To found a doctrine for the world, one must forsake the highest wisdom—how could it be otherwise?
To edit the *Shijing* (诗经) and establish the classics, only the Sage could suffice.

For the canons are the measure by which the people are guided, and the glosses are the footpaths of refined discourse.
If even a single character is not carefully scrutinized, it may lead to error for ten thousand generations.

Thus, to record without embellishment was prized by the ancient sages;
And to express without distortion was never the failing of the great scholars.

This trust is not lightly bestowed, nor is the responsibility easily assumed.
The *Complete Scriptures of the Jade Emperor’s Biographies and Deeds* (高上玉皇本行集经) are secretly transmitted through the golden mouth, their profound truths enshrined in the palace of jade. Even the lower immortals struggle to hear them, and in this turbid age, few can glimpse their brilliance.

Its mystical meanings penetrate the depths of the Stygian Sea,
Its true principles tower above the lofty Kunlun Mountains.
Each word reveals the path of liberation,
Each phrase kindles the breath of purity.

To praise them is to exhaust one’s breath—
Yet how could one ever fully comprehend their profundity?
If one encounters the passage of time too long,
Or transmits the text with careless errors,
Even the faintest mist may obscure the sun and moon,
And a minor flaw may mar the splendor of jade and pearls.

Who would have thought that the Sage’s benevolent wisdom,
Though vast, would still wish to preserve the scripture’s every virtue?

Thus, Your servant receives this gracious edict,
And, though unworthy, dares to accept this noble charge.
With trembling hands and humble heart,
I dare not presume to match the thoroughness of a meticulous weaver’s thread,
Nor fully expound the mysteries of the Dao—
Yet I strive to avoid excessive elaboration, lest it weary the reader,
Or invite doubt when discerning its deeper meaning.

Other revisions remain incomplete.
Your servant now respectfully presents this corrected transcription,
Praying for Your mercy and review.
If there be even the slightest benefit to the text,
May I be granted the honor of Your scripture’s promulgation.

Or, may Your servant humbly request that the relevant bureau be commanded
To further examine and expound its essential meanings,
Lest this work be scorned as a *San Chuan* (三传) scattering the *Chunqiu* (春秋),
Or criticized like one without the Nine Masters’ insight into the *Yijing* (易) Dao.

Your servant, with sincerity like flayed flesh and exposed vitals,
Dares to besmirch the divine ear’s favor,
And implores Your mercy for this presumptuous act,
That I may continue in my lowly duty.
I swear with the fidelity of metal and stone,
To repay Your boundless grace with utmost devotion.

Your servant’s emotions are beyond expression—
Gazing heavenward, awaiting the Sage’s judgment,
Shaken with reverence and trembling with fear,
I bow in submission, awaiting punishment.

Respectfully submitted in a memorial,
Awaiting Your imperial decree.

Year, Month, Day:
Your servant, Liang,
Memorial.

---

**Imperial Response:**

*"Your detailed petition and the corrected scripture have been received.
Your virtue is pure and harmonious, your literary brilliance radiant—
Your careful deliberation and diligent verification
Have not only corrected falsehoods to reveal the truth,
But also uncovered profound meanings within the text.

Moreover, your heart is warm and sincere,
Thus your words are clear and refined.
Your discernment is keen, your labor thorough—
It is fitting that this scripture be stored in the Inner Hall of Jade Sovereignty,
And proclaimed to all the heavens,
That from this day forward, all may recite and uphold it.
Further, command the Southern Continent and all other realms
To propagate this teaching among the multitude of true ones,
And let none dare to treat it with disrespect.

Additionally, Your servant is bestowed with
The Nine-Lighted Precious Seal and the Eight-Scenic Treasure Chariot,
As tokens of Your esteemed recognition of his merits—
Accept them with reverence, in accordance with this favor.

Thus, this response is given,
So that Your servant may be fully aware."*

Month, Day:
Issued.

chunks.original_text: 林少华受， 苍汝嘉付。 诵经感应 经中感验，自上古隋唐以来古今事实，旧尝备载藏本。 续略摘数事，附于卷后，以证此经功德不可思议。 陈王暴 隋时会稽人。 擢第入金门集，释褐任长城尉。 自少诵此经，每至厄难，多获助。 至开元中，自会稽江行之东阳，大雨。 与二十余船同发，乘风挂帆，须臾，天色昏黑，风势益壮。 至界石窦上水拥波击前，二十余船皆坏。 曝急念此经，流中忽有一物，状如赤龙，横出扶舟，因得达岸。 俱得活诵经之力。 银山老人 饶州人。 所居采银户逾万，俱是草屋。 延和中，天火发，屋皆烬，此居火不及。 时州牧问老人：有何术法？ 答云：奉道年深，日诵此经不阙。 慕容文远 隋人。
chunks.translated_text:
「Lin Shaohua received [the teaching], and the Venerable Master praised him.

Reciting the sutra yields profound resonance—
its efficacy is attested within the scripture itself.
From the ancient times of the Sui and Tang Dynasties onward,
historical accounts and present-day realities alike
have been fully recorded in the hidden treasures [of the scripture].
Herein, a few additional events are briefly noted,
appended to the end of this volume,
to demonstrate the sutra’s unimaginable **virtue/power** [不可思议].

**Chen Wang’s sudden awakening**—
a man of Kuaiji during the Sui era.
He passed the imperial examinations and entered the **Golden Gate Assembly** [金门集],
was appointed as a **Longcheng prefect** [长城尉] after his robes were first unfurled.
Since his youth, he recited this sutra,
and whenever he faced calamity,
he often received aid [from it].
During the reign of Kaiyuan,
while traveling east from Kuaiji River to Dongyang,
a great storm arose.
With twenty-odd vessels setting sail together,
they unfurled their sails against the wind,
but soon, the sky darkened,
and the gales grew ever fiercer.
At the **Boundary Stone Gorge** [界石窦], the waves surged and shattered the bows of the twenty-odd ships,
reducing them to ruin.
In dire straits, he fervently invoked this sutra,
and suddenly in the current appeared a form—
like a crimson **dragon** [赤龙],
stretching forth to steady his vessel,
thus enabling him to reach the shore.
All were saved by the **power** [力] of reciting this sutra.

The **Yin Mountain Elder** [银山老人]—
a native of Raozhou.
The silver-mining households where he dwelled numbered over ten thousand,
all living in thatched huts.
During the reign of Yanhua,
a celestial fire erupted,

chunks.original_text: 病亡七日，欲殓，忽缩一足，遂苏。 云被一人追入一城，见王者问：卿在生有何功德？ 文远答：贫家无力可修功德，惟一心念《玉皇经》。 王称善曰：此经欲得闻乎？ 遂延文远上殿，设一金床，令诵经。 忽有玉女，头翠凤冠，服紫霞衣，手指文远阳问所诵经本，跪言其前，令分明读诵，毕，忽不见。 出门唯有追吏随行，登一高山，见城郭极高峻，烟火接天，黑气缢地，哀叫之声不忍闻。 叩头求去，使者乃引回家，见形卧床，鬼吏自后推之，冥然复活。 窦德玄 麟德中为奉使，过扬州，渡淮船，见一人形惨悴，引一小童坐地上。 德玄曰：天晚，别无船来，何不同行？ 遂至中流，见本人有饥色，与食，济之达岸。 德玄上马，同行十里间，问：君欲何往？ 答曰：我非人，乃东岳鬼使，往扬州追大使窦德玄。 德玄惊怖，下马拜曰：我即是。 德玄涕泗请计，鬼甚愧云：公容载设食济急，柰何？ 汝急诵《玉皇经》一百部，当来相报。 德玄曰：世无本。 鬼使曰：钵洲灵仙观道士尹嗣玄有正本，可急索诵。 言讫不见。 德玄遂回，令人求经本，昼夜不断续，诵经一百部。 因昼卧，梦见前鬼使来唤，至一城殿门外，使曰：且立此，当白王。 使既入，德玄於外遥闻王怒云：尔何故漏泄吾事，为他作计？ 令左右驱决其使，使出，袒以示曰：此乃为公致此。 引入见，王问曰：公有大功德，算未尽，人间秩满，当生天界。 召使送回。 德玄问使者云：我将来官爵如何？ 答：汝从此可改殿中监，六十四至左相。 言讫辞去，觉后果如所言。 司马乔卿 唐时河内人。 永徽间为扬州户曹，丁母忧，结庐写经。 庐侧生芝草，绿茎朱盖，日滴汁一升，食之味甘。 经毕，母於座中语云：得汝追悼之力，今可生天。 李修 唐显庆中，丁父忧，发心写此经三部答劬劳。 才一部了，笔间有五色圆光之炁。 经毕，笔无所损。 每闻异香座前，时有花坠。 后失笔头。 经半载，夜因见地上有金色光彩，示之，乃向所失笔头，自然光彩不坏。 经之功德，孝诚所感，父得超升。 吕文展
chunks.translated_text:
When the sick man had been dead for seven days,
and they were about to wrap his body,
suddenly one foot shrank,
and he revived.

He said, *"I was pursued by a man into a city,
where a king asked me: 'In life, what virtue/power did you possess?'
I answered: 'My poor family had no means to cultivate virtue/power,
only to recite the *Jade Emperor Sutra* [玉皇经] with a single-minded heart.*
The king praised this and said: 'Would you like to hear this sutra?'
So he invited me to ascend the hall,
set up a golden couch,
and commanded me to recite the sutra.
Suddenly, a jade maiden [玉女] appeared,
wearing a crown of crimson phoenix feathers [翠凤冠],
clad in garments of purple mist [紫霞衣],
and pointing to the *Jade Emperor Sutra* [玉皇经] I had recited,
she knelt before me,
ordered me to recite it clearly and distinctly,
and when I finished,
she vanished without trace.
As I left the gate,
only the pursuing officials remained,
leading me up a high mountain.
There, the city walls rose steep and grand,
smoke and fire reached the heavens,
dark qi [黑气] coiled upon the earth,
and the cries of the mournful were unbearable.
I struck my head and begged to depart,
and the official then guided me back home.
I saw my body lying in bed,
with the ghostly officials pushing it from behind,
and I revived again in darkness.*

**Dou De Xuan** [窦德玄]
During the **Ling De** reign [麟德中],
serving as an envoy,
passing through Yangzhou,
crossing the Huai River by boat,
I saw a man in a pitiful state,
leading a small child,
sitting upon the ground.
I said: *"It’s late, and no other boats will come—
why not travel together?"*
At midstream,
I saw the man’s face was gaunt with hunger,
so I fed him
and helped him reach the shore.
I mounted my horse,
and after ten li [十里],
asked: *"Where do you intend to go?"*
He replied: *"I am not human—
I am the ghostly envoy of the Eastern Peak [东岳],
going to Yangzhou to pursue the great envoy Dou De Xuan."*
I was startled and fearful,
dismounted my horse,
and bowed in reverence: *"I am the one you seek."*
Tears streaming,
I begged for a plan,
and the ghost was deeply ashamed:
*"You spared me and fed me in my dire straits—
how could I repay you?
Recite the *Jade Emperor Sutra* [玉皇经] one hundred times,
and I will come to reward you."*
I said: *"I lack the original text."*
The ghostly envoy replied:
*"The Daoist priest Yin Si Xuan [尹嗣玄] of Lingzhou’s Spirit Immortal Temple [钵洲灵仙观] has the authentic copy—
go and urgently request it to recite."*
With that, he vanished.

I then returned,
sent someone to seek the sutra,
and without pause,
day and night,
I recited a hundred copies.
One day, as I slept,
I dreamed the ghostly envoy had come to call me,
leading me to a city’s palace gates.
He said: *"Wait here—
I will inform the king."*
The envoy entered,
and from outside,
I heard the king’s fury:
*"Why have you leaked my affairs,
and devised plans for another?"*
He ordered his attendants to drive and execute the envoy.
The envoy emerged,
stripped to show his wounds,
and said: *"This is for your sake."*
He was led inside,
and the king asked:
*"You possess great virtue/power—
your fate has not been fully exhausted.
Your human life is complete,
and you shall be reborn in the heavenly realm.*
He summoned the envoy to escort me back.
I asked the envoy:
*"What rank shall I attain in the future?"*
He answered:
*"From now on,
you may ascend to the Palace Attendant [殿中监],
and by sixty-four,
you shall reach the Left Chancellor [左相].*
With that, he departed,
and upon waking,
I found it had come to pass as he said.*

**Si Ma Qiao Qing** [司马乔卿]
A native of Hebei [河内] during the Tang.
In the **Yong Hui** reign [永徽间],
he served as the Yangzhou Household Officer [扬州户曹],
and upon his mother’s death,
he built a hut and copied the sutra.
Beside the hut grew a fungus [芝草],
with green stems and crimson caps [朱盖],
dripping juice each day—
one升 [升],
and its taste was sweet.
When the copying was complete,
my mother spoke from her seat:
*"By your filial devotion in reciting this sutra,
I have been granted rebirth in heaven."*

**Li Xiu** [李修]
During the **Xian Qing** reign [显庆中] of the Tang,
upon his father’s death,
he vowed to copy this sutra in three parts
to repay his labor.
As soon as one part was finished,
a five-colored circular light [五色圆光] of qi filled the brush.
When the copying was complete,
the brush was unharmed.
Often, I heard strange fragrances at my seat,
and flowers would fall.
Later, the brush tip was lost.
After half a year,
one night I saw golden light upon the ground,
and when I pointed it out,
it shone toward the lost brush tip,
its radiance undiminished.
The virtue/power of this sutra,
felt through sincere filial piety,
elevated my father to a higher realm.

**Lü Wen Zhan** [吕文展]

During the reign of Yanhua,

The elder replied:
“I have long devoted myself to the **Dao/Way** [道],
and daily recite this sutra without fail.”
**Mou Rong Wen Yuan**—

chunks.original_text: 唐开元三年任阆州。 信道，诵此经万卷。 年衰牙落，向经恳请，牙复生如旧。 时亢旱，刺史令祈雨。 诵经一徧，随获霈然。 又苦霖潦，别驾复令祈晴，立霁。 又一夜诵此经，见屋内光明若昼，有王者数人，与诸仙众长跪合掌，礼拜称善。 文展大惊，下座回礼云：文展无道法，得圣贤如此恭敬，罪当万死。 王者云：我等皆天人魔王，适向诸天，见此人间有光照烛，故寻光化身下降，云珍重而去。 出《金匮灵文》。
chunks.translated_text:
**Tang Kaiyuan** reign [开元三年], he was appointed to **Lan Prefecture** [阆州]. Devoted to the **Dao** [道], he recited this sutra ten thousand times [诵此经万卷]. As he grew old and his teeth fell out [年衰牙落], he earnestly prayed to the sutra, and his teeth regrew as before [向经恳请，牙复生如旧].

During a time of severe drought [时亢旱], the prefectural magistrate ordered him to pray for rain [刺史令祈雨]. After reciting the sutra once [诵经一徧], he immediately received abundant rain [随获霈然]. When there was prolonged flooding [又苦霖潦], the deputy magistrate again ordered him to pray for clear skies [别驾复令祈晴], and the weather cleared [立霁].

One night, while reciting this sutra, he saw the inside of his house illuminated as bright as day [又一夜诵此经，见屋内光明若昼]. Several **kings** [王者] appeared, along with a multitude of **celestial beings** [诸仙众], all kneeling and joining their palms in reverence, bowing and praising its merit [长跪合掌，礼拜称善].

**Wen Zhan** [文展] was greatly startled, descended from his seat, and returned the bow, saying: *"Wen Zhan has no Dao/Way* [道法], yet to receive such profound respect from the **sages and worthies** [圣贤], his guilt is deserving of ten thousand deaths* [罪当万死]." The kings replied: *"We are all **demonic kings of the heavens** [天人魔王], just now ascending to the celestial realms [适向诸天]. We saw this mortal world illuminated by a radiant light, so we followed the luminous transformation and descended in person. We cherish it and depart* [故寻光化身下降，云珍重而去]."*

From the *Jin Gui Ling Wen* [《金匮灵文》].
